Review Content: ADORO il vaso istantaneo. Mia figlia ne ha uno da mesi e ha creato dei piatti fantastici con i suoi. Ho esitato a comprarne uno, come con la mia pentola di coccio: ci vuole molto spazio e non lo uso spesso. La pentola di coccio aveva più di 10 anni, quindi ho deciso di donarla e sostituirla con la pentola istantanea che ha anche un'opzione di cottura lenta. La prima volta che l'ho usato, ho gettato dei petti di pollo FROZEN con un po 'di aglio, cipolle, peperoni, salsa e in 12 minuti avevo preparato dei fantastici tacos di pollo. Da allora, lo uso almeno due volte a settimana e si è guadagnato un posto permanente sul bancone della cucina. IP mi ha trasformato in una cuoca abbastanza decente.

Name: JasonGrimaldi
Review Title: La maniglia si è rotta molto facilmente e il servizio clienti non risponderà
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​4 febbraio 2018
Review Content: The handle broke off while I was putting the Instant Pot away. I have only used it a few times and owned it for just a couple of months, so it's not getting excessive use. It seems like a design flaw to me. I have contacted Instant Pot customer service multiple times to see if it's still usable -- I'm concerned that if the break is structural, it may make it unsafe to use the pressure cooker feature -- and no one has gotten back to me. All in all, a very disappointing experience from both a product and service perspective.If you are in the market for something to make cooking easier, I would recommend looking for a better quality product, sold by a company that stands by what they sell.

Name: S. S
Review Title: I can set it and walk away, low maintenance!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2017
Review Content: I am used to cooking with pressure cooker and never had an electric pressure cooker and never thought of getting one as I didn't care to understand the difference between both versions. Then my cousin told me he bought one of these and really likes it. So I was willing to give it a try and ordered a 3 quart version. Got delivered this afternoon and made dinner - mint rice pilaf - same recipe o use in the pressure cooker. In fact the rice cooked in the instapot turned out much better than the regular one I make using my pressure cooker on the stove. The 3 quart size is big enough for us and I am planning on trying various recipes soon.The main thing I like about it is, I can set the setting and walk away and don't have to check on it multiple times or don't have to turn the stove off. Perfect to set it up and go for a shower and come and my food is ready. Happy so far and I am sure I will use it a lot.I also paid $4 extra and got the warranty not sure it is helpful but thought I will get it anyways.Now I need to search for more vegetarian recipes online and start cooking.

Name: Marc & Julie B | RVLove
Review Title: Ideal size for RVs, condo, tiny home. Works great! Love it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2019
Review Content: Love my instant pot MINi! Great for our RV and works just as well as our 6Qt IP. When I originally bought our first instant pot a couple of years ago, the smallest available was the 5Qt but the actually size/weight was so negligible that I ended up buying the 6. I was so excited when the 3 quart came out and feel it’s the ideal size for an RV or just a couple or solo. That said, I do actually like having 2 IPs as sometimes I will cook rice in the smaller one and a meal in the bigger one. The 6Qt is probably better for families or potlucks or if you like to entertain, but if you are a solo, couple, and/or live in a small place - condo, tiny home or RV - then the 3 quart is a fantastic size and works well. Love it!

Name: Di D.
Review Title: And they peel like a dream even days later
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2018
Review Content: How did I live without this? I don't know. Seriously? 18 eggs at once?  And they peel like a dream even days later??? Whhhaaaattttt? And steel cut oats? OMG - amazingly creamy and NO STIRRING OR WATCHING!! I do sweet potatoes - and they never lose their color, stay juicy and are so good. And 22 minutes done! I cook a lot of fancy things  - and I have always been afraid of pressure cookers - this Insta Pot has taken away my fear.  I made a small brisket in 33 minutes under pressure - it was perfect. It also helps me make a batch of whatever I choose so that I can portion it for work lunches. Such a great product - and seriously? Unless you're feeding 5 people? The 3qt is all you need. Maybe you can't do giant cuts of meat? But do we really need to eat that much anyway? It's just perfect. Get it. You'll love it.

Name: JD Smith
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2018
Review Content: This is my first Instant Pot purchase. Five stars all the way! So far I’ve made the best slab of tender, fall off the bone, Baby Back Ribs of my life and some delicious peel and eat shrimp! I can easily tell that this device will be a spectacular addition to my kitchen. Simple setup and extremely easy to use! BUY ONE NOW! The 8 quart pot easily handles a slab of ribs, a large chicken and just about anything you can throw at it! This pot is simply AWESOME! YouTube is PACKED with videos detailing Instant Pot recipes, accessories and care!

Name: Das
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2020
Review Content: We use this everyday. We use this for mostly fora) cooking rice (every day)b) to make ghee out of unsalted butterc) to make chicken curryd) to make sambare) to make egg curryf) to make goat curryg) to make variety of south indian dishes like poriyal, kootuh) to bake potatoes, etcTo make all these dishes,  we have plenty of video in youtube

Name: J. Mitchell
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020
Review Content: I am an experienced cook.  Bought the 3 quart mini, accessory package, and cookbook.  I’ve tried over the last few months to use this pot—for rice, potatoes,,stews,chili, etc.  I just don’t get good results.  For example, I cook brown rice, white rice, quinoa, arborita, etc.  First you have to find on the internet how much rice and liquid—it’s different for each variety, and it’s different from the standard directions on the box.  You must program the time, and the amount of pressure. Then you have to determine whether to let it sit and naturally release pressure or immediately start bleeding off the pressure. You don’t know if it’s overdone and stuck to the pan or underdone and tough until you’ve completed the cycle and opened the pot.  Then it’s too late.  My cooking results have just been too unpredictable.  Old dog new tricks?  Maybe, but I’m giving it all away.  I really don’t recommend.

Name: J. Doyle
Review Title: "Instant Return" - involucro metallico estremamente sottile, arrivato danneggiato
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​30 novembre 2017
Review Content: ENORME ammaccatura nell'involucro esterno appena estratto dalla scatola: l'acciaio inossidabile utilizzato qui è sottile e può essere facilmente piegato con la punta delle dita. È stato in grado di estrarre l'ammaccatura con una ventosa, ma rimangono piccoli segni di danni e chiaramente sarà incline a questo genere di cose che accadono più e più volte con qualsiasi tipo di uso normale. Dato il peso elevato che ci si potrebbe aspettare da un fornello da 8 quarti, questo tipo di costruzione fragile non è affatto accettabile. Un peccato, perché non vedevo l'ora di usarlo.

Name: LaShawna Smith
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​16 novembre 2020
Review Content: Ero un po 'intimidito da questo apparecchio, ma ho deciso di tuffarmi subito. Il mio primo piatto era la zuppa di lasagne. Non sono riuscito a realizzare che ci vogliono alcuni minuti per pressurizzare prima che inizi effettivamente il conto alla rovescia di cottura. Quindi ho continuato a premere il pulsante di avvio. Dopo aver atteso diversi minuti, il bancone di cottura è iniziato stavo per andare. Ancora un po 'confuso su come pulire il coperchio, poiché non volevo immergere l'intero coperchio sotto l'acqua. In seguito ho capito che la guarnizione in gomma poteva essere rimossa insieme al tappo a pressione in metallo. Nel complesso, è stata una buona prima esperienza facendo la zuppa di lasagne.

Name: Leejay
Review Title: Temperature istantanee della pentola inaffidabili. Nessuna risposta dal servizio clienti.
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​12 gennaio 2018
Review Content: L'IP è stato acquistato su consiglio di un amico per fare lo yogurt. Da quando ho ottenuto la pentola ho provato a fare lo yogurt almeno una mezza dozzina di volte, con il prodotto finale sempre molto liquido. Nel mio ultimo tentativo, ho misurato la temperatura finale di "ebollizione" del latte a 165 gradi quando avrebbe dovuto essere 180. Ho rimandato la pentola attraverso la funzione Yogurt / Boil e dopo 15 minuti, ha emesso un segnale acustico che aveva raggiunto la temperatura. Questa volta, controllando il latte con 3 diversi termometri (2 erano elettronici), ho visto una temperatura media di 166 gradi. Il mio pensiero è che essendo di 15 gradi più freddo a 180 programmati, la macchina era probabilmente più fresca alla sua temperatura di fermentazione. Ho finito di fare il mio yogurt con altri mezzi.Il tentativo di ottenere aiuto dal servizio clienti di Instant Pot si è dimostrato frustrante. Comunicano solo via e-mail e promettono di tornare entro 24-48 ore. Ora si avvicinano alle 72 ore senza alcuna comunicazione da parte loro. Sto per inviare una terza e-mail.

Name: Cameron Keith
Review Title: Preoccupazioni per il controllo della qualità
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​30 aprile 2020
Review Content: Ive been using this for a little while now and it works great for everything I've done with it.my only two complaints are1: rice sticks/burns to the bottom no matter what i do, this is minor and just means i have to scrub harder when i clean it.2: my unit arrived with a golfball sized dent in the side of it, it hasnt affected its performance at all. The box was undamaged which means this was damaged prior to packaging. Quality control should have caught this.

Name: Neph
Review Title: You need this. Don't even second guess it. You need this.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2016
Review Content: I love this, I love this, I love this! And I really hate cooking. I have had this for a week and have made so many different meals that I don't think I have to go shopping for a while. I bought the 6 quart because it was on sale. I am so glad I did! I was eating out all the time and we all know what that can do to your budget. Read the instructions, do the water test just to get accustomed to how it works. If you read them while distracted you wont notice you set the delayed timer and not the cook timer and you will be unimpressed with the thing... until you notice your mistake and then you will fall in love.You prep all the food and most things you would do like browning meat will be done in the pot, not on the stove. -1 dish thereYou toss all the things into the pot, close the lid and set the time. *At this point you have a dirty cutting board and knife, maybe a measuring cup or twoYou wait for the pot to heat up until the time starts counting down. *So this time will be added to the cooking time, it all depends on the amount in the pot.The think kicks on and starts the cooking. I made a full pot of chicken stew in less than 1 hour.Once it beeps let it cool for a bit or just pop the release valve. It will hiss and steam will come out. Caution Hot.Clean up is simple, food is tasty, easy to use even if you miss a spot in the directions but don't do that.To make this even more amazing. I live full time in a travel trailer and this is a MUST HAVE. I may never eat out because I am lazy again.I am making sesame chicken tonight. All in one pot. Cooks rice just right! I am so going to try out this yogurt thing.

Name: NYJetBaby
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2019
Review Content: The unit is nice for cooking rice and so far I've found it to be just OK for the other foods I've tried so far.  The instructions are somewhat confusing and you cannot adjust the time for the rice cooking feature.  The manual states 4 minutes for some rices and the least amount of time you can do is 8 minutes so I had to use a timer and press cancel and HOPE the rice turned out OK and it did.  A 4 quart would definitely be a better size.  The saute feature is nice and you can saute before using the pressure cooker feature.  I have yet to try the slow cooker feature.  Maybe this one will impress.  I've made a few messes utilizing the quick pressure release as the unit spits and sputters all over the place.  You HAVE to let it sit before moving the gauge to the quick release or else you end up with a mess.  You can't run the pot under water and release the pressure as you can with conventional pressure cookers.  Glad I bought it on sale and sorry I didn't find one for about $30 at an estate or garage sale because this is about what I think this unit is worth.  It's difficult to find recipes on line for this little guy.

Name: JH
Review Title: Excellent - and just ordered Fagor steamer basket to go with it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2017
Review Content: Love it so far. I was disappointed though that they don't offer either a steamer basket, glass lid, nor silicon lid for the pot. I think for the money, it should have at least come with the silicon lid and the other two items could be optional, but at least available. If I could take off half a star for these annoyances, I would.I know I'm going to use this unit all the time for steaming since I tried it on green beans the other day and it was fantastic. The unit heats up to cooking temp in about 4 minutes and the beans are done in another 2 minutes or so. With this steamer basket I just ordered, I'm hoping this will work out very nicely.So, which 3rd party steamer basket? I did a fair amount of research and my decision came down to these two because I wanted a steaming container, not just a shallow steaming platform. I want to be able to pull the whole thing out easily and not have to worry about dumping some of the contents back into the steam water, if you know what I mean. So again down to these two:1. https://www.amazon.com/dp/B019D7MSZA/ref=psdc_289761_t2_B007SPKR8U - This one works according to some reviewers of the 8qt model. It fits if you remove the handles. For some folks that might be a bit of a challenge to remove those with a hacksaw or other tool.2. https://www.amazon.com/Fagor-998338900-Pasta-Basket/dp/images/B0000717BM - I chose this one.I chose the Fagor because it has a handle that swings out of the way and I did ideally want a handle. One thing I don't know about this"pasta basket" is whether it has holes in the bottom. After all it is a pasta basket, not a steamer basket specifically. If it doesn't have holes in the bottom, I'm going to test steaming and see how it works since there are plenty of holes on the sides. Seems to me it should work quite well whether there are holes in the bottom or not. But, if I'm wrong and think it's not performing quite right, I'll drill holes in the bottom if they are indeed not already there. I can't tell from the picture. It also does not have a platform to raise above the water, so I'll just put the Instant Pot trivet beneath it.So far I made chicken soup (came out great and fast), boneless country style ribs (came out fall off the bone tender and tasty in an hour), and the green beans I steamed. The steaming feature really surprised me how fast it is. After all pressure cookers always take awhile to heat up. But I'd forgotten that it's only heating up about a cup and a half of water, not six quarts of liquid and solids before it's up to temp. So, it's very fast steaming. I'll update this review in regard to the choice of steamer basket. Option #2 is a bit more costly though but still reasonable, I think. It was $18 including shipping from Fagor.All for now...

Name: BUZ_TUED
Review Title: Wish I would have bought it sooner
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2019
Review Content: Update: one year later and still going strong and getting used on the daily. I absolutely love this pressure cooker it cuts down cooking time and it’s so easy to clean. My mother in law loves it so much she bought 2 for herself.After going through a Navarro and Walmart pressure cookers I decided to go for the Instand Pot and I absolutely love it. I’ve given it a few months before I wrote this to make sure it didn’t let me down and it hasn’t. The cooker gets used DAILY at my house for a lot of things and nothing gets stuck at the bottom. I’ve even used the pot alone on the stove to make mango marmalade since I didn’t have a bigger pot and it was super easy to clean afterwards.  It cooks very fast and has options for the amount of time/pressure for preset Options which is great for rice in particular because it doesn’t need the amount it has preset.

Name: Skeeter Bite
Review Title: Faster than fast food that’s good for you
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2018
Review Content: This is the perfect size for a single person or a couple. I bought the mini along with the ekovana stackable stainless cooker inserts.The mini is so kiss simple to use that it’s like it reads your mind, but the results turn you into a Michelin chef! I like the ability to either use the preprogrammed options or to use it manually. And the wide variety of things you can cook with this little powerhouse is incredible: aside from the usual type of meals you would expect, you are able to make yogurt, cheesecake, puddings, the list is only limited by your imagination!And the clean up is so easy! This mini is small and easy to handle for cleaning: it’s not huge or heavy making it difficult to clean. Take out the liner ( stainless steel), hot soapy water - clean up done! Quick wipe down of the unit- done. It’s very easy to clean the seal, so it’s easier to clean up the IPot and liner than scrub out pots and pans. It’s like having a vacation with great food.Even if you already have an IP or maybe a pressure cooker you need this mini for cooking sides or just for quickly cooking a meal; it’s fastee than fast foods and much healthier for you. There is no downside to this little IP. Happy cooking! 🤗

Name: JudyC
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2014
Review Content: I'm not much of a cook and I've ruined meat more than I'd like to admit.  The Instant Pot gives me HOPE !!  I've used it several times since receiving it in early January.  It offers a range of tools from simple to complex.  Until I become totally familiar with it, I have to double check the user's manual, but when I don't try to "wing it" I have great success.I find that with some cuts of meat, I have to add time to the cooking because they just need more time.  For example, corned beef takes longer than most recipes will suggest.  It was much better the second day with additional cooking.So far, my best outcomes have been chicken cacciatore, chili and beef stew.  Next up will be chicken breasts and pork roast.  I expect to be successful.One suggestion:  if the cut of meat is likely to be tough try using the pressure cooker setting as in the recipe, then turn it to a lower/slower setting for another hour (or whatever time you think it needs).  My beef stew was better the second day because when I reheated it, I actually was cooking it longer.I think I will need to experiment with what works best for each cut of meat and learn from experience.SO GLAD I bought this thing !!  Because, so far, it's given me great results.  Lots of recipes on line, too.I really like the saute feature as most recipes allow you to saute the meat and onions/garlic/celery etc., then add the other ingredients, close the lid, and set it/forget it.One thing I have to remember is to allow it to get to full pressure before manually setting the timer.  A couple of times I thought it was cooking only to discover that I had not let it get to pressure.READ THE USER'S GUIDE !!!  And check out all the online recipes.Actually, I just sent one to my sister who needs to start eating healthier meals on a limited budget.UPDATE:  FEB 15RICORDA QUANDO HO DETTO DI LEGGERE LE ISTRUZIONI? Bene, stavo usando il pulsante TIMER invece del pulsante REGOLAZIONE. Quindi tutto quello che stavo facendo era ritardare l'inizio del tempo di cottura. DUH !!! L'impostazione della pentola istantanea per cuocere manualmente i miei alimenti richiede di impostare PRIMA la pressione. POI, REGOLARE manualmente il tempo in su o in giù utilizzando il pulsante ADJUST. Fai tutto questo entro i primi 10-15 secondi dopo aver iniziato il processo o dovrai premere il pulsante Annulla (TASTO KEEP WARM) e ricominciare da capo.

Name: R. White
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​30 gennaio 2018
Review Content: Un prodotto utile, che ci permette di cuocere i fagioli in una sera invece di iniziarli una notte (ammollo) e finirli la successiva (cottura per un paio d'ore). Questo completa il processo in circa un'ora. Vari fagioli sono stati gli occupanti più frequenti della pentola. Altri includono zuppe e stufati, che vengono fatti in un batter d'occhio. Meno 2 stelle per le indicazioni confuse su come impostare l'ora o il tipo di cottura. Un giorno farò un milione impiegando una settimana per capire le indicazioni e riscrivendole in "utili e comprensibili". È quasi come se non volessero che tu usassi l'attrezzatura.

Name: Talyah
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​4 agosto 2020
Review Content: Non voglio più stare senza InstantPot o questo coperchio AirFryer .. questi due apparecchi mi hanno cambiato la vita. Tuttavia, dopo un mese di utilizzo, il coperchio dell'AirFryer ha smesso di funzionare. Ho provato a contattare InstantPot per chiedere aiuto prima di restituire il coperchio della friggitrice, ma è stato in attesa per quasi un'ora prima di decidere di contattare Amazon.com per avviare un reso. Fortunatamente, oggi è stato l'ultimo giorno prima della chiusura del periodo di restituzione .. Ne avrò sicuramente un altro ma sono triste di dover passare attraverso questo processo.

Name: Stuckshutter
Review Title: Mi unisco a una lunga fila di clienti felici e ho preso la pentola, ora il mio microonde mi manca ...
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​21 febbraio 2021
Review Content: Brucio acqua e ho problemi a cucinare tutto ciò che non va nel microonde, anche i ramen sono una sfida ... Essendo stanco di quello che potrei ottenere da un microonde, un mio amico mi ha convinto a prendere uno di questi. Sorprendentemente, la cosa maledettamente ha funzionato alla grande con solo pochi minuti di lettura ed era semplice da usare e da pulire. Dopo aver capito una o due cose: assicurarsi che l'anello di tenuta sia posizionato correttamente sul filo e mettere abbastanza liquido; cucinare usando una qualsiasi delle migliaia di ricette è altrettanto facile, anche per un ragazzo che conosce a malapena un cucchiaio da minestra da un apriscatole. Ho capito che durante la pulizia ha alcune minuscole parti che possono essere facilmente danneggiate o perse, quindi ho aggiunto un kit per circa $ 6,50 che aveva anelli di tenuta di ricambio, valvole di pressione e tappi di tenuta per la valvola.Aggiungi un coperchio in vetro, è comodissimo se lo metti in frigo. Ora, ho cose davvero gustose e il mio forno a microonde mi manca.

Name: LA Wnbg
Review Title: Impedito l'annullamento della cena quando il fornello si è rotto!
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​18 novembre 2018
Review Content: Yes, it does all that. I’m giving it a rating for durability that I hope it earns. It cooked about everything for a dinner party for 4. Thank goodness we hadn’t invited more people when the stove (that’s a non-standard size!) broke. I sautéed pearl onions perfectly in it beforehand. I pressure cooked chicken into perfectly done (Food Network Instant Pot Adobo chicken recipe - 66 reviews and 5 stars) while we ate the salad. It was hard to brown the chicken parts because it’s surface area is small, but that was the only hitch.Sad to say, it replaces an available-only-at WalMart Instant Pot with greater surface area  that was recalled for electrical issues, but a recall that WalMart failed to note on their website. Amazon has informed me when they sold me something that was recalled, so I’m buying it here from now on.

Name: It's Just Me
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2019
Review Content: so far I am impressed by how meat and chicken turn out in this pot. Specially if you are following a recipe tailored to the pot. Boiled eggs turned out good too. I am still to master steaming veggies, my carrots were over cooked, need less time next try. Squash soup was quick. Rice is better on the stove for me. I cook Jasmine but I bet brown and wild rice would be better. I usually use canned beans, but interested to try to cook beans in it. I bet a chilli recipe from scratch would turn out great. So as you can see many possibilities to explore.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2020
Review Content: I own 2 other 6 qt Instant Pots and absolutely love them. One issue is though when I make beans or rice, I don't always want a big batch. My wife and I don't have the same tastes, so I can make a smaller recipe/batch that is just for me and this 3 qt works great for that.

Name: Jesse Johnston
Review Title: A Game Changer For Meal Preps
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2020
Review Content: I have been using this instant pot every week for several months now and it is a game changer for my meal preps. It is easy to use, but I did find the instructions a little unclear. I ended up watching a couple videos on Youtube which explained the features of the instant pot a lot better than the instructions. After getting it set up and getting familiar with it, I never looked back at conventional cooking for my meal preps. It saves so much time in preparing my meals and it easy to find recipes online. Literally thousands of recipes are available to you and can easily be made using the features on this product. Now I did notice that the rubber ring that goes in the lid absorbs the smells of strong spices. It is almost impossible to get rid of the smell, but thankfully doesn't affect the taste of the dishes. All in all, I'd say this is an awesome product and highly recommend it to people that need a fast and easy way to cook for a family or for busy people that don't have an hour to spend on cooking something.

Name: AKM
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020
Review Content: So glad I have this. I got the 3 quart one which is perfect for a family of 2 with with with a baby. I love the size. I already have an xl multicooker so I wanted something small that i could use everyday. I have been making non dairy Soy yogurt once a week and its enough for the whole week, 2 servings a day (i am yogurt crazy lol), i also made an egg quiche and I basically cook with it everyday. Not just for pressure cooking. I love cooking something and keeping it warm. I love the stainless steel liner. Very happy with the size, for those complaining its too small, read the description before buying something lol its called mini for a reason.

Name: Leslie
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2020
Review Content: I'm not new to electric pressure cookers, but this is my first Instant Pot. When I did get my first pressure cooker about three years ago, IP was way out of our price range so I went with a different model. It was fine, and it worked, but developed a few quirks, and because of it I didn't ever really deep dive into pressure cooking, but rather used it for the basic things. It finally got to the point where it had more issues than benefits and my husband told me to order a new one, a better one, and a bigger one. I ended up getting the 8qt Duo Nova, and have zero regrets. I did have a laugh because they describe it as a "beginners" model because of the auto sealing lid and push button release. Who wouldn't want those features?!? Honestly, those were the two main selling points because I felt like I could start teaching my 12 year old how to use it and not worry about whether she would remember all the things. After using the IP multiple times I feel like they should just make those two things standard on all models going forward. I love not having to worry about whether it's sealed/venting, and the push button release is amazing.After using my old pressure cooker, the IP feels like upgrading from a compact car to a luxury SUV. I've literally used it at least once a day since I got it. Everything has turned out amazing. Yogurt, rice, chicken curry, dump cake... all good, and things that I hadn't even bothered to try with my old pressure cooker. I also love the 8 qt size. You can fit cheese cake and other baking pans up to 9" in diameter inside. Photos are of the box before opening, homemade yogurt with fresh dragon fruit from our yard (yum!) and a dump cake I made in the time it took to make a pot of coffee. Comes with basic instructions in the box, but definitely go to the website for more in-depth info and cook times, and also download the app. You can set your device in the app, then it auto adjusts the recipes to your specific cooker :)

Name: Angela
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2019
Review Content: I have made soups, rice, chicken, bread, cake, all sorts of things in this guy. My mom had a pressure cooker before I bought this and got rid of it because it was a pain to use. I showed her how my Instant Pot works and she couldn't believe how simple it was to use. I bought the 8qt, which so far has been perfect for feeding a family of four - some leftovers, but not much and not every time. I've read some people keep two of the sealing bands around, one for sweet and one for savory, but I've been using the same one for both and have noticed no difference. The sealing band definitely retains smells though. I made a spicy lentil soup a while ago and the band smelled like that through multiple cookings until I made split pea - now it's smells like split pea lol. Doesn't impact cooking, and I'm cleaning the band appropriately, it's just a normal occurrence with that type of material, so don't panic when yours does that. Would definitely recommend, speeds up cooking times dramatically.

Name: Mmo6
Review Title: Qualità, ma non così diversificata o utile come ci si potrebbe aspettare. Si prega di consultare la recensione completa.
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​26 gennaio 2020
Review Content: Questo è un prodotto di qualità. La mia lamentela è che in realtà non è istantaneo. La carta che arriva vantando dei tempi di cottura minuscoli per una varietà di cibi è fuorviante in quanto, probabilmente a causa delle variabili di volume tra gli utenti, include solo il tempo di cottura attivo. Non tiene conto dei 10 + minuti di pressione o del rilascio rapido di 3 minuti o anche della depressurizzazione naturale più lunga (20 + minuti). Stai considerando 30 minuti in molti casi invece di 3, e spesso molto di più. Detto questo, alcuni processi che richiedono davvero molto tempo utilizzando metodi tipici sono molto più veloci, come polli interi, fagioli secchi e arrosti. Questo aiuta a produrre carne tenera da tagli meno teneri, quindi è buono lì. Inoltre, puoi rosolare un blocco di carne di cervo macinato da 1,5 libbre congelato più velocemente che scongelarlo e rosolarlo in una padella. Il riso impiega più tempo in questo che sul fornello una volta raggiunte le pressioni pre e finali, e nessuno sano di mente lo vorrà per le verdure che possono essere riscaldate in 1-5 minuti con attrezzature convenzionali. Per quanto riguarda le zuppe, sembra essere l'ideale, tuttavia alcuni ingredienti perdono la consistenza desiderata sotto la pressione necessaria per cuocere la porzione di carne. Molte ricette dicono di aggiungere cose che richiedono meno cottura più avanti nel processo ma che ricomincia da capo l'orologio della pressurizzazione. Non va bene. Assicurati solo di averne bisogno per prodotti che richiedono molto tempo o di taglio duro o che come me spesso dimentichi di mettere la carne fuori dal congelatore in tempo per scongelare per cena prima di investire. Mette al pascolo il latte, fa yogurt, sigilla barattoli e cuoci lentamente. Ho provato a fare il brodo usando l'impostazione brodo ma non ero soddisfatto del risultato, poiché non si è gelificato come dovrebbe. Ho provato a cuocere lentamente i quarti di coscia di pollo e dopo 6 ore quello in cima era ancora fresco al tatto e nessuno era cotto.

Name: AddictedToAmazon
Review Title: Come ti amo, Instant Pot Duo? Lasciatemi contare i modi....
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​10 dicembre 2015
Review Content: Instant Pot 7 in 1 Duo è il vaso istantaneo di ultima generazione e il mio TERZO vaso istantaneo! Ho bisogno di questo? Non proprio, ma di sicuro lo volevo !! Ha così tante caratteristiche brillanti che sembra sempre essere sul bancone. Anche se avevamo una ricetta nella pentola, sembrava sempre che ci fosse qualcosa che avremmo potuto preparare se solo avessimo avuto un altro rivestimento interno in acciaio inossidabile. Poiché mio marito è ugualmente dipendente, poco dopo è arrivato il secondo piatto, The Smart Pot. Le differenze tra il piatto 7 in 1 Duo e il primo piatto, The Lux, sono VAST--Non devo più chiedermi dove mettere un coperchio caldo. Si adatta comodamente alle fessure su entrambi i lati delle maniglie. I livelli di cottura MULTI-TEMPERATURA garantiscono SEMPRE una cottura perfetta, compreso il pulsante SAUTE che può essere utilizzato per rosolare le carni o soffriggere le verdure. Ecco un breve elenco di alcuni dei nostri cibi preferiti, per i quali usiamo regolarmente i nostri Instant Pots. E con questo, intendo ogni giorno! Brodi e brodi da zero • Zuppa da zero • Quinoa in un minuto • Avena tagliata in acciaio, 3 minuti • Le uova sode sono facili da sbucciare e escono perfettamente ogni volta • Thai Congee • Peperoncini di numerose varietà • Pollo congelato / carne, ecc., che risulta essere tenera • Tutta la zucca invernale!  Ho imparato moltissimo dagli autori che vendono libri di pentole a pressione su Amazon. Jill Nussinow è una di loro. Quando l'ho contattata facendole alcune domande, immagina la mia sorpresa quando mi ha risposto subito! Laura Pazzaglia è un'altra autrice non solo leggendaria, ma anche una persona esperta su tutto ciò che riguarda Instant Pot. Dopo aver acquistato Instant Pot e ti senti perso, non esitare a contattare gli autori di libri di cucina.   Non lavoro per Instant Pot o per questi autori. Però provo una grande gioia da tutti e tre!

Name: Jeabird
Review Title: Creatore di yogurt e molto altro ancora
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​24 aprile 2017
Review Content: This kitchen tool is the cats meow!Seriously!!!I bought for the primary purpose of making yogurt. Which it does... perfectly!But also have made several dishes as well as toasted an entire chicken in well under 30 minutes!  Everything comes out moist and flavorfully infused!I made a pot of brown rice, the rice was plump and moist. Excellent. The cooking time was cut by approx 35%I think the 6 quart all in one instaPot is the best kitchen tool I have ever had. It can replace your slow cooker, rice cooker and is easy to clean. I do recommend purchasing the extra lid gaskets. I did not, and I had a heck of a time Terri g my corned beef and cabbage smell out of the gasket. Will be ordering extras to havenone set aside just for yogurt making.Oh.... and the yogurt? It is so creamy and delicious. You can leave in for just 8 hours for a healtybprobiotic yogurt that still had some natural sugar inherent to the mil.Or cook for full 24 hours for the most heath benefits.The full 24 hour yogurt cycle (standard setting) cooks off the rest of the sugars and develops billions and billions of super probiotic bacteria, that tastes like heaven! So creamy and delicious!I start my morning with a couple of tablespoons of the probiotic yogurt topped with anti-inflammation raspbbrrrirs, blueberries,blackberries and sometimes a little bit of banana.For added fiber, I often sprinkle some kashi crisp or other kashi cereal.Amazing!

Name: Ixthyz
Review Title: Buy this pot and you'll not be disappointed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2018
Review Content: I was introduced to this pot by my vegetarian sister and vegan nephew.  I am just starting to experiment with the multiplicity of options but it is definitely a keeper.  I cleared out my rice maker, yogurt maker and pressure cooker and could have also gotten rid of my slow cooker if I had wanted to.  I've cooked dry soy beans, dried black beans, quinoa and beets and each recipe has turned out as expected - nutritious and delicious. I have been advised to check on-line recipes in addition to the enclosed recipe book since some measurements need to be tweaked.  Buy one for yourself, give one as a gift and remember this as a winning wedding gift for domestic and foreign weddings.  It's an all round winner and clean up has been a breeze!

Name: John Owens
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
Review Content: My wife absolutely loves this device.  We have done a solid two weeks of daily dinner just in this unit.  There's tons of available recipes online and an endless amount of options with this unit.  I would recommend this size over the smaller one (6qt) just for the flexibility.  People are "scared" of pressure cookers for some reason but they're seriously a great tool and relatively safe to use.  When you can have a complex thing like risotto come out of this and it's perfectly done, that's a huge win in my book.  The only upgrade from this unit would be an "air-fryer" lid.  But that's so situational, this one does 95% of what we needed it to do.  This would be great for dorm or travel cooking too.

Name: Kathleen P.
Review Title: Very nice and easy to use
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2021
Review Content: We bought this because we saw the potential to use it in our camper.  It has worked out well at home and will bring it camping this summer.  The pot replaces multiple cooking pots and pans.  We saute in it, slow cook in the crockpot setting, and pressure cook.  Interestingly, we have found that the dishes are more flavorful the next day.  I think it needs to sit and let the flavors intermingle together.  So I make a dish the night before and just warm it up the next day.  I wish there was a cookbook that went with it.  You can get recipes online from the company.

Name: natalie milberg
Review Title: 8 quart v.2 burns everything no matter what
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2018
Review Content: I bought the instant pot duo 8 quart in 2017 and it was the v.1 model. I made everything in it and it worked well for about a year and then it broke. I called the company and basically they told me they would do nothing because it was out of warranty. I decided to buy a new one and it happened to be the v.2 model. It burns everything. Every time unless it’s soup. I called the company and they would not offer to exchange it. Their big idea was to add extra oil and water to each recipe and cook on low pressure. Guess what? It ruined all my recipes and still burned the food. Apparently they changed the heating apparatus in this new version of the 8 quart and even when  I carefully deglaze, it burns everything. Instant pot won’t do anything about it.

Name: Sola
Review Title: Outstanding appliance for small-kitchen or dorm cooking
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2019
Review Content: Although it can be a bit pricey, the Instant Pot is a fabulous appliance to have when cooking in a reduced sized kitchen or dorm. Also it is great for students, athletes, and working people who need to start a meal early in the day and don't have time to tend to it or cook during the day. Meal prep-wise as a collegiate athlete, the Instant Pot has made a world of difference in meal prep- I've used it to make Bolognese/spaghetti squash from scratch, chili, pulled pork for tacos, turkey stock, roasted pork tenderloin, and many soups which is a lifesaver in the busy winter/competition season.It's worth noting that there's a genuine learning curve to the Instant Pot and it is advised to follow recipes for the first time you use it.Additionally, the size is perfect for dorm storage and makes enough to feed a small family, a few roommates, or a single person for ~4 meals on most dishes.

Name: Steph
Review Title: Good for vegetarian/vegan cooking as well
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2019
Review Content: I went back and forth over buying this for a long time. I worried that we wouldn’t get that much use out of it because we don’t eat meat and it looked like a lot of the meals I was seeing being cooked in these were meat based. I was still curious so I decided to go ahead and buy it and I’m glad I did! I like it a lot and we use it often. Some of the cooking times can be misleading because you have to wait for it to come to pressure before the “cook time” starts. I’ve read that takes a long time for some people but luckily we haven’t had that experience. Overall it does save a lot of my time because it’s hands-off cooking. I put the ingredients in, turn it on, and then I can walk away and do something else. I don’t have to stay there and stir or watch the food cook.Some of my favorite things to cook in it are risotto, quinoa, oatmeal, beans, sweet potatoes, and curry. It’s good for easy, one-pot meals. We put quinoa or rice and water on the bottom and then add a bunch of veggies on top, pressure cook for 1 minute for quinoa and 4 minutes for rice and have a really quick and easy meal that tastes great.My only complaint is that some vegetables are too delicate for the instant pot and they turn to mush. Broccoli for example, even being in there for 1 minute turns way too soft for my liking. To fix this we cook whatever it is we are cooking and then when it’s done we add the broccoli and put the lid back on with the instant pot turned off or on the keep warm setting for a few minutes. That seems to cook the broccoli just enough that it is bright green but still crisp the way I like it.I also appreciate the safety features. I was scared of pressure cookers before lol. My parents had a stovetop one that I would never use because I had heard stories of them exploding. I feel like the instant pot is really safe because you can’t open the lid when it’s under pressure even if you tried. It’s locked.It also makes a cute noise when you put the lid on and take it off.Overall I really like this thing! I’m excited to try making yogurt in it and see what other meals we can come up with. It is worth the cabinet space it takes up.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: I don't know what took me so long
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
Review Content: Avevo provato una pentola a pressione prima e non mi piaceva. Una collega era entusiasta del suo Insta-Pot e mi ha convinto a provarlo. Wow, adoro questa cosa. Potrebbe essere il mio apparecchio preferito in assoluto. Suppongo che faccia risparmiare tempo, ma la cosa più importante per me è essere in grado di cucinare velocemente il cibo senza doverlo fare da babysitter! La pasta non traboccherà. Le uova non si spezzeranno e non usciranno né troppo cotte né troppo crude. Adoro il fatto che mantenga il cibo caldo per tutto il tempo necessario. Il 3 qt. mini si è rivelato perfetto per due o tre persone, quindi non occupa molto spazio prezioso sul bancone. Se hai dei dubbi su come acquistare uno di questi gadget, fai il grande passo! Non te ne pentirai.

Name: DOTTY OWENS
Review Title: Ottimo prodotto, fai solo attenzione quando cucini con salse dense
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​19 dicembre 2019
Review Content: Amo il mio Instapot. Ho acquistato questo perché avevo bisogno di uno più grande. Quello originale che avevamo era un po 'troppo piccolo. Mentre questo funziona allo stesso modo di quello più piccolo, questo più grande ha la tendenza a bruciare il cibo o il liquido sul fondo della pentola quando si usa una salsa densa, come la salsa di pomodoro o qualcosa del genere. È più probabile che il cibo / la salsa si brucino se usi prima la funzione saute. Le istruzioni dicono che se fai soffriggere prima, lascia raffreddare l'unità prima di iniziare ad aggiungere l'ingrediente rimanente. Questo sembra aiutare a evitare che il cibo bruci sul fondo della pentola. Potresti anche voler diluire anche la salsa. Ho scoperto che anche questo aiuta. Detto questo, amo ancora l'Instapot. Sto solo più attento quando cucino con le salse. Non cambierei questo Instapot per niente.

Name: David Southard
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​8 marzo 2021
Review Content: L'ho comprato per sostituire il mio Crock Pot e per la maggior parte ha fatto quello e poi un po '. Lo uso sia per la cottura a pressione del pollo che per gli alimenti a cottura lenta. Pulire è un gioco da ragazzi e mi piace che durante la cottura lenta posso tranquillamente toccare l'esterno senza bruciarmi. Dopo averlo acquistato, ho acquistato anche un cuociriso Zojirushi (consiglio vivamente BTW). Da quando ho capito questo, la mia lamentela principale con il vaso istantaneo è che il cavo non si ritrae. È un cavo più grande e non si avvolge bene, ma purtroppo questo sembra essere il modo in cui la maggior parte degli apparecchi sono come in questi giorni.

Name: TNW
Review Title: Servizio clienti molto scarso da Instant Pot, ma ottimo servizio clienti da Amazon
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​10 agosto 2018
Review Content: Mi piace molto il mio Instant Pot ma ha smesso di mantenere la pressione dopo circa un anno di utilizzo e lo uso solo poche volte al mese. Ho contattato direttamente Instant Pot, che è ciò che ti chiedono di fare nei loro documenti, e non ho mai ricevuto risposta da loro. Ho aspettato circa otto giorni e ho contattato Amazon. Entro 2 giorni ho avuto il mio sostituto. Posso accedere al mio ticket per il servizio di supporto online con Instant Pot, ma non ho ancora ricevuto risposta da loro.

Name: Gman
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​13 dicembre 2019
Review Content: Acquisto verificato

Name: kara b.
Review Title: Sealing ring broke twice, food quality is mediocre
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
Review Content: I have had this instant pot for almost two years now, and most of the issues I had were within the first six months. Twice the sealing ring stopped working properly and the Instant Pot would not pressurize properly as a result. This was extremely frustrating, and though customer service did end up sending replacements both times, the process was tedious. I had to send in videos describing the issue and showing the process with the Instant Pot. Looking online it was clear to me this is not an uncommon issue. If you are fortunate enough to receive a unit that doesn’t break within the warranty period, the product itself is fine. I found most recipes tailored for the Instant Pot are usually not very healthy, with some exceptions. I do not use it often anymore as I have found that it does not shave off that much cooking time, though this will depend on what type of foods you choose to cook.

Name: christine
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
Review Content: On its face, seems simple:  choose what you are cooking and it should be automatic, but it is far more complicated than that.  First, you never know what you are going to get when you chose one of the preset options (e.g., "porridge" - how long?  does that involve pressure?  when will I be able to open it?).  The most annoying thing about cooking with this pot is that you NEVER know how long it will take.  Even if you used it before with the same settings, it could take longer to heat up this time, and then if you are using pressure, you don't know how long it will take to cool down enough to reach a safe pressure for opening (yeah, when the release pops, but WHEN will that be?), which makes it extremely difficult to plan a meal time.  Oh, and I love how this is marketed to "put everything in the pot, set it, and forget it -- it will cook when the timer is up and the meal will be ready when you get home, etc."  How can you do this with anything that has MEAT in it and be sure it will be safe to eat?!  Also, clean up can be a pain since half the time stuff burns to the bottom (it gets extremely hot on the bottom, while the top can still be freezing!).  This leads to the big question of HOW MUCH WATER to add?!  Supposedly, the pressure option will seal so you don't lose water, but since you never know WHEN that will happen, you have no idea how much water to add-- too much, and you have soup instead of stew, too little, and stuff burns to the bottom.  We have tried many of the included recipes, as well as some from the internet, and some have worked well and others haven't, but the main issue is there has been no consistency, so what worked before doesn't necessarily work the second or third time.  It has been a guessing game from the start, and still is (we've had this now for probably 2 years).  Haven't yet tried to make yogurt, but I want to give that a try to see how the low and slow works -- maybe we'll have better luck with that...

Name: Observe_the_cat!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2019
Review Content: Yeah, I'm now on the Instant Pot bandwagon!  My dad sent me the larger 6 qt. for Christmas, but for my family of two, it was too large.  The 3 qt is the perfect size for me and my husband, and I get maybe 4-6 servings per recipe.  I'd buy this just to make risotto, honestly.  It was SO FRICKIN EASY TO MAKE.  I'm obsessed.  I have also made chili mac, soup, lentil sloppy joes, and a Thai noodle dish that ended up spurting peanut sauce everywhere.  I've had no issues converting the 6 qt recipes to the 3 qt - just make sure you don't go below or past the liquid lines.  The Instant Pot is very easy to use and easy to clean up.  I recommend buying the plastic lid so you can keep your meals in the fridge if you don't put them in containers.  I live in a small NYC apartment and this fits easily in a cabinet - doesn't take up much space at all.

Name: War2d2
Review Title: If nothing else, it’s an amazing rice cooker
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2019
Review Content: I got this because of the hubbub surrounding it as the new “it” gadget for the kitchen. While I haven’t yet gotten a feel for how to use it properly for full meals, there are three side dishes I use it for regularly that it is pretty awesome for: corn on the cob, potatoes, and, in particular, rice.It’s basically the world’s best rice cooker, and anything else it does is just extra. I put in two cups each of rice and water, half a stick of salted butter cubed up and distributed around the pot, and a little bit of salt, and just use the built-in program for rice. It turns out perfect every time, and it’s so much easier than messing with a pot and a timer.I’ll eventually start looking into things like pulled pork or beef stew, but for now it’s already a win as far as I’m concerned.

Name: Happy Nana
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2020
Review Content: I was so afraid to begin using this since I watched my mother have problems with the old-fashioned one we had when I was a small child.  I was scared to death and feared my mom's pressure cooker might explode every time she used it.  I finally decided to try mine out 3 months after I purchased it and OMG was I thrilled at how easy it is!  I made a perfect dish of country style pork ribs.  It was so tender and I had no need of a knife when I had dinner.  The meat was perfectly cooked and my fear of pressure cookers diminished!  Now I'm eagerly deciding what I'll cook next.  This is a wonderful addition to my kitchen and now I wish I'd purchased it a lot sooner.  It has cut way down on cook time and now my repertoire is growing.  There are so many recipes I plan on trying.  This is so easy to operate and I'm just so glad I decided to spoil myself a bit by buying it.  I'm an empty-nester and find it difficult to scale back on meal-sizes but I'm getting better at it and I think this size is perfect for my needs.  I'm able to freeze portions and I'm set for the future with pre-made meals thanks to my freezer.  I was surprised to see how easy clean-up is.  I just can't say enough positives about this amazing small appliance!  This would be a perfect gift so I'm looking forward to the next occasion I'll need a gift for.  Just made shopping way easier too!

Name: Laura E
Review Title: Received two Instant Pot Duos that both stopped working
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2021
Review Content: A friend of mine purchased an Instant Pot Duo back in 2017 (or so), and it's worked perfectly for her ever since. Entirely reasonably, she thought to gift me one in January of 2021. Unfortunately the product I received only worked 4 times, but defective items are a possibility. So we made arrangements with Amazon to replace the product. The replacement arrived and worked 6 times. I checked out official Instant Pot guides, some 15+ YouTube videos, countless articles... no dice. It won't seal. Bought new seal rings, new pressure pin caps, nada. It acted like it was pressurizing, the pin rose, the gasket was turned to Sealing... no pressure-steamed food. Just hard as a rock cauliflower, crunchy damp broccoli. Instant Pot really needs to look into their 2020 model releases, because what are the chances that I'd receive not one, but two completely defective models?

Name: smplocher
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​15 gennaio 2016
Review Content: AMA QUESTO! Cucino da anni e sono abbastanza bravo, ma mi sono annoiato, troppo occupato ecc. Ecc. - Conosci tutte le scuse che si usano per "finire il tempo" quindi dobbiamo semplicemente uscire e prendere qualcosa da Taco Bell (Oppure inserisci il tuo ristorante fast food preferito). Ad ogni modo, non avevo mai nemmeno visto una pentola a pressione nella vita reale. Alcuni dei miei blogger preferiti (Paleo Parents, Nom Nom Paleo per citarne due subito) avevano menzionato questo meraviglioso dispositivo, ma non ne ho fatto molta attenzione b / ca) il costo eb) nessun frame di riferimento. Poi la mia cara madre mi ha chiesto se ne volevo uno. Aveva letto di loro e me ne offrì uno per Natale. Ho detto SICURO! (chi non lo farebbe?) È arrivato. E adesso cosa? Ho iniziato a cercare su Google "come cucinare con Instant Pot" e ho trovato molti siti Web e ricette molto utili. Ho stampato una ricetta, (ho letto prima i manuali ovviamente) e ho iniziato con Chicken and Dumplings. INCREDIBILE e VELOCE e DELIZIOSO! Ero incuriosito. Ho comprato i due libri di cucina di Bob Warden: Great Food Fast e Slow Food Fast, e anche Hip Pressure Cooking (adoro i libri veri). Li ho divorati per tecniche, suggerimenti, ecc. E poi sono entrato a far parte della Instant Pot Community su Facebook. Sto ADORANDO usare questo dispositivo. Mi piace sfogliare i libri di cucina, stampare le ricette della Comunità e poi andare in città. È così facile, le istruzioni sono chiare, c'è un sacco di aiuto là fuori e tutto quello che ho fatto finora si è rivelato assolutamente delizioso! Posso persino cucinare carne congelata (un venditore enorme per me - leggi la prima frase! " Non sono sempre bravo a pianificare in anticipo) Ora posso tirare fuori una ricetta, metterla sul tavolo in breve tempo e sapere che sto dando alla mia famiglia pasti deliziosi, gustosi e sani. Questo vaso istantaneo vale il suo peso in oro. Ho fatto un arrosto (ooh-la-la!), Polpette di Porcospino (non sono mai venute fuori prima, stasera sono eccezionali!), Pollo e Gnocchi (nessuno meglio dai miei giorni senza glutine), Zuppa di pollo e riso selvatico, stufato di manzo, uova sode (COSÌ facili da sbucciare) e il mio pollo intero sta cuocendo proprio ora mentre scrivo. (Ho fatto le polpette di porcospino prima di partire per il lavoro in modo da avere qualcosa da riscaldare velocemente per cena prima che la mia famiglia esca a guardare le partite di basket). Il pollo lo mangeremo, poi domani farò qualche partita di brodo di ossa. Non riesco a credere che questo dispositivo stia rendendo di nuovo divertente la cucina !. Non ho provato a farne di più della cottura a pressione, anche se qualcuno sulla Instant Pot Community (Facebook) ha pubblicato qualcosa sullo yogurt al cocco nell'IP. Indovina cosa farò questo fine settimana (dopo aver preparato il brodo di ossa - e avrò tempo b / c non ci vorranno 24 ore come farebbe in una pentola a cottura lenta!)? Non ti pentirai del tuo acquisto. Come diceva Tony the Tiger "It's Grrrrrrrreat!"

Name: Michele H
Review Title: Questo è tutto ciò di cui hai bisogno nella tua cucina!
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​2 gennaio 2019
Review Content: Sono così felice di aver acquistato questo prodotto! Ne sono letteralmente ossessionato e non ho nemmeno iniziato a utilizzare tutte le opzioni! Instant Pot è davvero l'unico elettrodomestico di cui hai bisogno per preparare piatti gustosi e sani. In effetti, gli altri miei elettrodomestici si sentono trascurati perché non li uso più! Adoro il fatto di poter preparare una cena in pochissimo tempo. La preparazione richiede il tempo più lungo, quindi entro 20 minuti hai un pasto fantastico. Suggerisco di acquistare il coperchio temperato e il ricettario insieme ad esso. Il coperchio si adatta perfettamente alla pentola interna in modo da poterla riporre facilmente in frigorifero. Il mio brodo di pollo migliora ogni volta che lo preparo. Non ho mai apprezzato gli avanzi fino ad ora. Il 3 qt è la dimensione perfetta per me. Mi dura una settimana. Penso che l'utilizzo di Instant Pot mi faccia risparmiare un sacco di soldi. Questo è un acquisto di cui non ti pentirai. Questo è un fatto!! Non vedo l'ora di provare la funzione Yogurt e di preparare molti altri piatti. Una delle cose migliori della pentola è che non devi sporcare un mucchio di pentole e padelle. Fate soffriggere e mettete gli ingredienti nella pentola, regolate i controlli e il gioco è fatto. Il piatto fa tutto il lavoro! Facile da usare e facile da pulire .. Adoro questo fantastico elettrodomestico. Scommetto che lo farai anche tu!

Name: Topolino
Review Title: Possiedo il mio IP da quasi 5 anni e lo adoro ancora!
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​6 luglio 2020
Review Content: Volevo ricontrollare il modello esatto di IP che possiedo prima di acquistare un accessorio per esso e ho rilasciato che lo possiedo da quasi 5 anni e ho deciso che era ora di scrivere una recensione. Adoro il mio vaso istantaneo. Possiedo una pentola a pressione tradizionale che ho usato raramente perché sentivo di aver bisogno di guardarla costantemente, quindi ero riluttante a investire in un IP. Sono così felice di averlo fatto. Ho usato il mio IP almeno due volte a settimana da quando l'ho comprato e qualche volta 3 o 4. Ho fatto di tutto, dal cucinare uova sode, cuocere le costine, per cuocere una cheesecake. Non uso quasi mai la mia pentola a cottura lenta dedicata, perché posso rosolare la carne direttamente nell'IP e utilizzare l'impostazione SC.My most used accessories are the steamer basket, spring form pan (meatloaf), extra liner and extra sealing ring. The least used is the hard boiled egg steamer rack (the steamer basket holds a lot more and is easier to use).I have since given an IP to my sister, mother, and a niece, plus several of my favorite accessories.If my IP died tomorrow, I would feel certain that I had more than gotten my money's worth and immediately buy another.

Name: Ender
Review Title: Great time saver, wish it could test its pressure seal
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2021
Review Content: I'm not sure why but now when using it every other time the seal doesn't take and it leaks once it builds up pressure. I've bought replacement rings, both third-party and first party replacements with no luck. Thankfully I found a trick, make sure the vent is set to seal mode. then place the lid on quickly to force extra air in, the pressure of that air will pop up the seal valve (the metal rod) if you got a solid seal, and if it doesn't take it off and try again. Eventually once it pops up just give it a second and it will settle down since its not truly sealed until you turn it, which you can't do until the valve pops down again.Honestly I wish they'd include some sort of small air pump to pressure test the vessel when sealed but before cooking to verify it will hold but my work around indeed works every time so its still usable to me.

Name: Vanna
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2020
Review Content: Seriously, the Instant Pot is the greatest kitchen tool I've ever bought! I also bought the I.P. Air Fryer Lid and a regular I.P. lid. The pasta is excellent - add pasta (penne), cover with water, Pessure Cook for 3-mins and Natural Release for 2-mins - real al dente. Do the same for rice Fun noodles (thick) - perfect - so easy.I also steam canned fig jam (plus boiled my jars), made lovely roasted chicken quaters (with the added surprise of getting perfect gelatinous stock from the drippings), Pressure Cooked chocolate brownies (perfect), made spaghetti sauce, and perfectly cooked grains - farro, wheat berries, buckwheat- it's only been a month.Very small learning curve, but there's plenty of online help and it's easy to experiment.Get the 6-quart if you're going to get the fryer lid too.Thank you, Instant Pot!

Name: Leti
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2021
Review Content: I love this pot, unfortunately mine came with several pieces missing from the package,  like the untensil kit and the condensation collector. They were great the first time I messaged and sent me the items I asked, minus the condensation collector. I've messaged them again a few times asking about it and now they will no longer reply.

Name: Aireal
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2017
Review Content: I LOVE my new instant pot as soon as I got it a did the recommended test which helps you get accustomed to the machine and breaks the ice. I then could not wait and wanted to cook something.  I had 7 large frozen boneless and skinless chicken breasts from jewel and figured it says you can go straight from frozen to delicious meals in no time without thawing etc.  So I did it. I placed all 7 large straight from freezer chicken breasts into the pot and set the machine. In less than 40 minutes I had the moistest and perfectly falling apart cooked chicken breasts like I have never had before. the machine is a super star and I will use it for everything I can.  I love this thing and its my first pressure cooker ever. I did my research online for all models pro's and con;s and settled for this brand and I am very happy I did.  Solid well built unit with tons of options that others lack. Plus this unit comes in not only 4 quart and 6 quart like most others but also has an 8 quart which is the one I purchased and and very pleased that I did.  Can never have to big a pot for those special occasions when you need to cook more than usual. This 8 quart can also cook things down to as small as 1 cup of rice perfectly.  I will be making all my meals in the instant pot not only for the taste and tenderness but also for the 95% vitamin retention it renders within all foods cooked in it.

Name: Kayakamama
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020
Review Content: Cooked a large pork roast to fall apart tender in about 40 minutes instead of hours in the oven.  Can sear and roast in same pan - saves on clean up.  Alerts you if your meat is in danger of burning.  That is such a blessing.  I'm dairy intolerant so I won't use yogurt maker.  Can make whole meal - meat, rice, veggies all together, just add rice and veggies at appropriate time.  There are tons of free recipes on the internet.  Would definitely recommend to friends and family.  I am so delighted that when I broke by 44 year blender jar, I ordered the instapot blender, which also had delighted me.

Name: Rebecca S. Gray
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020
Review Content: Non ho mai saputo quanto potesse essere utile un oggetto del genere - mio figlio ne ha preso uno per il suo studio (non ha un forno o alcun elettrodomestico) e cucina tutto dentro - petto di pollo sminuzzato in meno di 20 minuti, ecc. Quindi mia figlia ne hai uno e cuoce le verdure, cucina la carne, puoi persino fare lo yogurt. Ci ha fatto delle costolette in meno di 20 minuti! Sono stati fantastici. Questo è molto meglio di una pentola di coccio. Puoi anche cucinare rapidamente carni congelate. Siamo innamorati di questo: non usa tanta elettricità come una stufa o un forno e non riscalda la nostra casa calda. Vale oro.

Name: Tim Scott
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​27 novembre 2020
Review Content: La prima pentola istantanea da possedere, come la pentola interna in acciaio inossidabile poiché non posso usare pentole con teflon (materiale antiaderente), i fumi sono mortali per i pappagalli. facile da usare, cuoce i fagioli secchi come una bestia.

Name: idateacher2
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​8 gennaio 2016
Review Content: Possiedo diverse pentole a pressione, tutte versioni da fornello. Adoro quelli, ma l'ho acquistato per il fattore convenienza. Con questo modello puoi semplicemente caricare la tua pentola, impostarla e non devi andare a regolare la temperatura o il tempo una volta avviato. Il vantaggio aggiuntivo sei tu se non lo fai subito quando hai finito, si imposterà automaticamente per tenerlo caldo finché non sarai pronto. Lo svantaggio della versione elettrica rispetto al piano cottura è che i modelli con piano cottura sono molto più veloci.Sono rimasto soddisfatto di quanto poco spazio occupasse il mio bancone ed è più leggero di quanto mi aspettassi. Ci sono una moltitudine di funzioni preimpostate per aiutarti a evitare congetture, ma tieni presente che dovresti comunque confermare il tempo di cottura prima dell'uso. La pentola in acciaio inossidabile è eccezionale: evita di acquistare unità rivestite in quanto non dureranno a lungo. Puoi anche usarlo su una stufa a gas per dorare prima, o semplicemente usare l'opzione di doratura offerta dal fornello. Si noti che questo ha solo circa 11 psi per l'impostazione "alta pressione", quindi se si utilizza una ricetta per fornelli da cucina sarà necessario aumentare il tempo del 7% -15% per compensare. Questo è un modello da 6 quarti, quindi se hai una famiglia numerosa (più di 4 persone) cerca qualcosa con una capacità maggiore. Per questo motivo uso frequentemente un modello Fagor da 10 quarti. Le indicazioni per impostare il piatto sono così così. Un consiglio è quando si posiziona il coperchio per la prima volta, impostare la freccia sul punto "aperto", non corrispondente alla freccia sull'unità. Questo è diverso dai miei modelli di piano cottura, in quanto con quelli devi prima allineare le frecce e poi ruotare il coperchio. Pulire la pentola è facile, quindi non preoccuparti che non sia di tipo antiaderente.Ricette: non ci sono molte ricette fornite con questa unità, ma abbastanza per darti qualcosa con cui lavorare. Al momento dell'acquisto di un libro di cucina, ne consiglierei uno progettato per cucine elettriche per eliminare le congetture su come regolare il tempo. Il libro di Bob Warden "Great Fast Food" contiene ricette facili e piacevoli con ingredienti comuni, e "The Great Big Pressure Cookbook Both Stovetop and Electric" è ancora meglio dato che i tempi sono elencati per entrambi i tipi di pentole e ci sono molte fantastiche ricette da scegli da. Sono un grande fan dei libri di cucina Lorna Sass, ma quei tempi sono per i fornelli, quindi preparati a fare molti aggiustamenti. Se sei nuovo nella cottura a pressione, vai con il Great Big Pressure Cookbook, poiché ha una solida sezione introduttiva su come usare la pentola. Dai un'occhiata al blog chiamato "Aggiornamento: sono scioccato da quanto lo uso - mujltiple volte ogni settimana. Ha semplificato la cottura e ho facilmente risparmiato il costo del gadget grazie alla drastica riduzione di quanto andiamo a mangiare fuori. Lo yogurt è molto più facile da fare in questo rispetto al mio ex produttore di yogurt, e posso fare una grande quantità (richiede fino a un litro di latte). C'è un gruppo Facebook che offre una vasta gamma di idee e risposte rapide alle domande, quindi dai un'occhiata. Ho già acquistato più di queste unità da regalare e ne acquisterò una seconda per casa mia. Considera i modelli usati - ho comprato uno di questi affari "di magazzino" - è arrivato in ottime condizioni e non sono sicuro di come sia stato anche considerato usato a parte probabilmente un reso non aperto. Il costo era solo 75 per quello, quindi un ottimo affare. Mio marito ha fatto dei taglieri su misura da mettere sopra i miei fornelli a gas, perché sì, non uso più molto il fornello e questo mi permette di usare lo sfiato del forno quando rilascio la pressione. Amo questa cosa!

Name: Curtis E.
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​24 gennaio 2019
Review Content: Adoro questo! I tempi di inizio e fine sono diversi dal "tempo di cottura a pressione", quindi non lasciarti ingannare da questo, ma il tempo è molto più veloce di prima e molto più conveniente! Ad esempio, il riso in quattro minuti non è pronto in quattro minuti. Devi lasciare che la macchina si scaldi, pressurizzare e poi cuocere per quattro minuti e poi il tempo di depressurizzazione. Quindi circa 25 minuti per avere il riso duro pronto per il tavolo, molto velocemente rispetto ad altri metodi.Non dover immergere i fagioli e averli in tavola in 30 minuti-1 ora contro diverse ore è semplicemente fantastico!

Name: Jeff P
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​26 agosto 2020
Review Content: I'm not a big fan of cooking. Baking? Yes. This baby does both with ease. I'm much more likely to take my turn making meals for the family with my Instant Pot. I've also made countless cheesecakes and lava cakes for dessert. I've also made lots of Starbucks knock-off egg bites and I've recently started to make yogurt, which is super easy. I would strongly recommend this product.Along with the pot itself, I purchased extra sealing rings to keep one for meat/rice/meal items and another for sweets, and now the third for yogurt. Otherwise, the flavors tend to leak into other foods. I also purchased a 7" springform pan for cheesecakes and some silicone baby food freezer trays for my egg bites.

Name: kathi
Review Title: don’t get rid of your slow cooker!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2020
Review Content: i got the 3qt a few months ago, now just giving it a try.  Brown rice........first batch using the 1:1 ratio Instapot uses, was just awful little pebbles.  2nd batch, upped the water 25% and the time an additional 5 minutes on high, instead of low pressure.  better, but still not serve-worthy.  i added 1/2 cup of water and put the pot on again for 10 min.  so now we are up 35-40 min to make the rice, so this machine is no better than the stovetop method.  warning, the control panel does not give you a countdown on your timer.  so you need to set a separate timer if you want to know the status of your dish.  i have used a stove top pressure cooker for years, and this machine is no better.  i will use it for parties and holidays where stove space is at a premium, and if this machine dies......i will not replace it.

Name: K & D
Review Title: Best investment in our kitchen, hands down!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2020
Review Content: Love love love my Instant Pot!  I had my first one for nearly 3 years and it was destroyed during a move recently (they packed it in a box with some other heavy items and then dropped the box 😭).  We were reimbursed for the damages and I did research on what IP to replace it with since there are newer models now and ultimately settled on the exact same one I had before (8 qt duo).  I make yogurt about twice a month and use the IP for dinner at least once a week.  It is seriously the best addition to our kitchen!!

Name: Mahesh
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2019
Review Content: The pressure release valve is wobbly and reached out to the manufacturer couple of weeks back. No respond to the ticket still. Is it suppose to be wobbly? It locks well on release position but doesn’t on sealing position. I don’t know if the cooker is defective or is this how it’s suppsoed to be.Update - 2/4:Right after posting review here I got a response from Instapot. After a few back and forth email messages on some tests they want me to perform confirmed on 1/22 that the unit needs to be replaced. However they are out of stock and still waiting for the replacement unit. It’s now close to two months since I bought one and I don’t have a properly working unit yet.Update 11/22/2020:I received a replacement unit in Feb’19 and worked well until a month back. And the unit started to behave the same way I.e., steam releases when in sealed position. I reached back again to product support and I am told the unit is out of warranty. However I believe the units are faulty by design if the same issue occurs repeatedly with multiple units. Instant Pot is overrated and do not waste your money.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: Pot Only Worked Once Then Short Circuits
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2017
Review Content: Loved the pot, it worked as described, very impressive. Then 2'nd time I tried to use it keeps blowing the GFCI. Confirmed nothing wrong with the outlet, pot is dry, no damage,  the pot has a short circuit, blows the GFCI, and no longer works.  Useless. Total waste. ???

Name: Sarah C
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2018
Review Content: This Instant pot surprised me. It’s my third pot as I already own an 8qt Duo & 6qt Ultra.I probably use this one the most. especially for oatmeal in the mornings, but I can cook a whole bag of beans in it, a whole chicken, and its perfect for my brown rice. I have to say that I'm impressed.

Name: Judy L.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2014
Review Content: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2014

Name: Tisha
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2018
Review Content: Never knew an appliance could have such a cult following! I’ve had this for about 4 months. I use it at least 3x a week. It’s been such a great addition to my kitchen. I got rid of my slow cooker and rice cooker. I even bought an duo80 as a secondary for when I need a larger capacity or cooking two things at once.But the 6 quart is what I use most often. We are a family of 4 (2 kids under 10) and so far I have felt the 6 quart has been perfect for us. It also comes to pressure a bit faster than the 8 quart.I recommend joining some recipe groups on social media. So many ideas.What I like most about this product:1) one pot cooking. Most recipes everything is cooked in one pot. From sautéing to browning, then pressure cooking. You don’t even have to pressure cook if you don’t want to.2) pretty much set it and forget it! Once you start it you can walk away and do stuff. And it’s a much shorter time than a slow cooker. So I don’t have to load it up in the morning before work.3) so many recipes are out there! So many! I’ve tried Indian Butter Chicken, spaghetti and meat sauce (with noodles), rice is so quick!, honey garlic chicken, chicken adobo, chicken pho ga, chicken soup, ribs, even cheesecake and banana bread.4) Cooking from frozen! When I’m in a pinch and not sure what to make I can always take out some frozen chicken to make something. In fact I keep a whole, pre-seasoned chicken in my freezer all the time (3-4 lb). I’ll pull that out. It takes about an hour and a half because I like to broil it after for 5–10 minutes.Seems like a long time but it’s from frozen! Frozen!5) una pentola in cottura = una pentola da pulire

Name: Nancy Brodie
Review Title: sembra che il coperchio sia rotto e non reggerà ...
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​9 aprile 2018
Review Content: L'ho acquistato per mia figlia per Natale. Mi è stato consegnato solo in un sacchetto di plastica che pensavo fosse strano, ma OK. Mia figlia è appena andata a usarlo per la prima volta e non funziona, sembra che il coperchio sia rotto e non terrà la pressione. È passata la data di ritorno, quindi immagino che dovrò acquistarne uno nuovo e controllare per assicurarmi che funzioni subito. molto deludente! 4-12-2018: Voglio essere chiaro su questo articolo, si scopre che era un prodotto usato di cui non ero a conoscenza, ma dopo aver parlato con un rappresentante Amazon mi rimborseranno i soldi. Amazon ha sempre fatto la cosa giusta per me, non ho altro che parole fantastiche su di loro. Amali, amali, amali

Name: Tracy
Review Title: Avrei dovuto acquistare un modello più piccolo?
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​9 febbraio 2018
Review Content: Sono innamorato. La vita è più facile. Dal momento che è così veloce rispetto a una pentola a cottura lenta, mi chiedo se avrei dovuto comprare il modello più piccolo, ma ce l'ho da qualche mese e in realtà penso che dato che metto su molte delle mie zuppe, ecc. Preferisco avere il modello più grande. È abbastanza grande, però. Richiede una certa quantità minima di liquido, non riesco a ricordare cosa sia, ma alcune ricette che troverai elencheranno meno acqua, quindi dovrai aggiustare le ricette raddoppiando o scoprendo se puoi semplicemente aggiungerne di più , altrimenti non otterrà effettivamente la pressione abbastanza alta. Finisco per fare la carne e le verdure separatamente perché cuocerà troppo le verdure. Dipende da cosa stai facendo e da cosa preferisci.

Name: Justin
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​9 gennaio 2021
Review Content: L'ho avuto per un anno intero e alcuni mesi e me ne sono innamorato. Ho comprato molti accessori come il colino per yogurt, il cestello a rete per cuocere le verdure al vapore e la mini teglia per muffin, la cheesecake e altro ancora. La scatola è arrivata con una piccola ammaccatura sul lato, che ha messo un'ammaccatura morbida nell'alloggiamento dell'instapot, ma non abbastanza per agitarsi con un ritorno. Se segui tutti i protocolli di sicurezza e fai attenzione, funziona come previsto. Ho preparato zuppe, arrosti, verdure e cheesecake.

Name: Rick
Review Title: Pressione e cottura lenta come avrebbe sempre dovuto essere.
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​27 novembre 2017
Review Content: Tonight was my first trial of the new Mini Instant Pot.  This is the second one I have and is well on its way to be my favorite.  Cooking for two, I seldom need the higher capacity of the larger models and haven't pressed to see how small a quantity I could cook without issues.
