Tonight was my personal mix or whole grain rices with a 1 cup rice quantity.  It came out well.  I will try half the quantity next time to better match the needed quantity.I cook at sea level and also at 6000 feet in the mountains.  The Instant Pot does pressure cooking by temperature, so I can use the same recipe at either altitude.  This new Mini will relieve me from carrying my one pot from one altitude to another.From my standpoint, this is pressure cooking as it should have been.  No fussing with the burner flame and when there is steam enough ... just pick a cooking time and match it with the right liquid level for reproducible results.  I do less slow cooking because we like the that approach less, but again, it runs without constant attention.

Name: RFA
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2020
Review Content: Works very well.  Unless you have a real reason to buy the bigger model stick with the mini as it is still pretty big and you'll save money.  If you use it for what it was meant for it should last a long time.  I bought it to pressure cook meat that way I can buy cheaper cuts.  Haven't experienced any of the things like those who posted neg responses and tbh some seem to be fishy. I dont see how the hard cover could melt and not the seal as its pretty sturdy. If you have prob with steam coming out of the nozzle, cover it with a cloth or wait for pressure to go down. Also disconnect it when not using it to extend the life of the pot and avoid electrical issues.  If you can buy it in a store do so as sometimes damages happen during delivery.

Name: Tomokun
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2019
Review Content: My wife and I used to hate cooking, mostly because of all of the time and effort it took to cook different dishes. Using different pots and pans (and then cleaning them afterwards) was a big headache.We heard good things about the Instant Pot and so we gave it a try. We love it! It is now our go-to appliance for steaming vegetables for most meals. The "set it and forget it" style of Instant Pot is such a relief after years of steaming vegetables in a pan or wok on the stovetop and keeping a close eye on it. Using the Instant Pot also frees up space on the stovetop for other cooking. We have also tried stewing, sauté, but we definitely use the steam function most often. Instant Pot is amazing! And it's now an indispensable part of our cooking lives.

Name: Judy Stokes
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2018
Review Content: I would give the product a second star, but the lack of support takes it away.  A little history.  My wife wanted to buy a rice cooker, I suggested an Instant pot instead as it would do more.  She was right.  We got a good deal($75) before the holidays and I put in a serious effort to get to know this thing.  Right off the bat, I got a lot of 'BURN' notices (sic, remember the show?).  Even when using recipes specific to this item?  BURN.  Usually 2-3 before actual pressure cooking.  BURN, open, scrape/stir/add liquid, repeat.  Tomato soup?  BURN!  Sauce, stew, vegetarian/chicken/beef chili, pulled chicken, chicken stock?  BURN!  It takes a lot of the speed out of the thing, especially if you're not watching for the BURN, come back expecting a finished meal only to be disappointed.  I researched, changed how I stacked things in the pot.  Stopped sauteing in it completely.  BURN BURN BURN.  So, over a week ago I finally after waiting too long for an exchange and possibly return,  contacted Instant Pot's support.  I got an open support ticket with an email.....that's it.  Eight days and not a peep.  They mention a holiday backlog?  The holidays that ended weeks ago?  I even tried replying to my own support ticket to see if it kicked the tires?  Nope.  Either they're completely inundated with problems or incapable of support OR maybe I didn't reach the level of deserving support?  Any way you look at it, if you're thinking of buying this should concern you.  I am ashamed that I fell for the whole 'cult' thing that seems to drive this product, I thought I was immune to and wary of fanboyism.  To be fair, all but one batch of rice didn't 'BURN' nor did the one time one made chicken soup, so it's not all failure.  This is supposed to be a time saver and my experience proves it's anything but.  Even as a rice cooker, I tested it side by side with my stovetop method and starting from cold, the Instant Pot is almost a minute slower.  Buyer beware of the product and the fanboys that guard it like it's their child.  BURN!

Name: PK
Review Title: No "no pressure" steam option like the Evo
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2021
Review Content: I would have bought the Duo Evo Plus if I had realized that I needed to buy it to be able to steam with no pressure.  Even the low pressure option ruins rice in my opinion.  I tried all sorts of cooking options - more or less water, more or less time cooking.  I even tried pressure cooking for a short interval, followed by the slow cooker option.  Using the reduced amount of water that the manufacturer recommends causes the rice to be similar to puffed rice in some ways, a little like a rice cake.  And using a normal amount of water causes the rice to be overdone on the edges of each grain before the center of each grain gets fully cooked.  I can understand that some people like the pressure cooked rice, but I've come to the conclusion that high quality brown rice requires the absence of pressure.

Name: andowd
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
Review Content: Purchased this last year with a giftcard I got for Christmas. It's a dinnertime game changer. So versatile, easy, and QUICK! Many of my families new favorite dinner recipes come from this Instant Pot. For ideas just get on Pinterest - there are so many fantastic blogs out there with amazing recipes. However, I did dock a star because I just can't stand out smelly the rubber/silicone (?) gasket gets after cooking savory dishes. It is virtually impossible to get the smell out. I recommend doing what other reviewers have mentioned and definitely buy another one if you plan to use the pot for sweet dishes too. I have tried so many ways to remove the smell and just can't seem to get rid of it. It's frustrating, but overall the ease and deliciousness of the dishes I make far outweigh the smelly gasket ring.

Name: DB
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2016
Review Content: Verified Purchase

Name: OaklandBookworm
Review Title: Tweaks del timer; tempo di cottura vicino al piano cottura
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​3 gennaio 2017
Review Content: Ho comprato questa pentola a pressione elettrica dopo aver fatto ricerche e aver esaminato i consigli sui prodotti. La mia prima unità ha avuto un problema; è stato sostituito prontamente in una transazione molto regolare. La mia unità attuale emette un segnale acustico quando dovrebbe, esegue tutte le sue funzioni senza problemi. Tuttavia, ho scoperto che quando permetto all'unità di impostare l'ora per me per "carne" o "pollame" non ottengo i teneri risultati di caduta dall'osso per cui sono famose le pentole a pressione. Ho regolato il timer, aggiungendo sempre più minuti e i risultati sono stati buoni, ma quando stai dando da mangiare a una famiglia affamata è difficile dire "l'ho impostato per altri 15 minuti" (oltre a 35+ minuti con l'impostazione automatica) . Continuo a modificare il tempo e si avvicina la cottura ai fornelli. Allora quali sono i vantaggi? beh, il suo autocontrollo. Puoi impostarlo e portare a spasso il cane. Al termine del tempo di cottura, l'unità entra in modalità "caldo". È una sorta di incrocio tra una pentola di coccio veloce e una pentola a pressione con controllo automatico. Mia madre aveva una di quelle pentole a pressione vecchio stile che tu pregavi non facesse mai saltare in aria, è un piccolo regolatore di vapore oscillante da solo, ma con esso ha preparato innumerevoli pasti cadenti e cadenti. Sono fino a 40 minuti per uno stufato di manzo e più o meno lo stesso per pollo e riso. Li ho fatti entrambi sul fornello, con gli stessi sapori come risultato e una tenerezza leggermente migliore per il pollo. Non dover tenere d'occhio è il più grande vantaggio di questa pentola a pressione elettrica, sto ancora lavorando per capire i tempi di cottura perfetti - non è negli autoset! L'unità è ben realizzata, ha un buon design, grandi pulsanti / letture facili da leggere, e ha vari controlli e bilanciamenti quindi è più sicuro (sembra più sicuro) rispetto alle pentole a pressione sul fornello. I componenti sono in acciaio inossidabile, facili da pulire e la pentola interna estraibile va dalla cucina al tavolo da pranzo al frigorifero. È una specie di compromesso. Vorrei poterlo amare di più.

Name: P
Review Title: Sono abbastanza sicuro di poter sopravvivere senza una stufa / forno con solo una pentola istantanea per davvero
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​7 febbraio 2020
Review Content: Mi ci sono voluti sei mesi per trovare il coraggio di usarlo. E ora vivo con questa macchina. Così tanto che stavamo pensando di ottenere un IP più grande e abbiamo già gli accessori a portata di mano! Di solito non cucino a causa della confusione con i tempi, il calore, il monitoraggio costante della stufa, ma questa pentola istantanea mi dà la libertà di lasciarla sola e tornare a un buon pasto! Sono abbastanza sicuro di poter sopravvivere senza una stufa / forno con solo una pentola istantanea per davvero

Name: AGLEZ
Review Title: È durato un mese !! Modifica 18/6/20 da 1 a 5 stelle
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​2 gennaio 2020
Review Content: Questa recensione è per l'IP che ho acquistato il 01/12, che è durato un mese. L'ho adorato mentre funzionava. Oggi dopo anni in cui non ho fatto una zuppa completamente carica ho deciso di fare. Acquistato tutti gli ingredienti e collegato. Era MORTO. Ho provato un altro sbocco e niente. Ho controllato alcune recensioni con un punteggio di 1 e questo sembra accadere in alcune occasioni. Sono ancora sotto il programma di sostituzione di Amazon, quindi andrò avanti e ne ordinerò un altro. Lo sto facendo perché ho comprato in saldo per $ 50 e sembra che abbia preso uno dei pochi limoni. Ciò non dovrebbe accadere, però. Una volta ricevuto il mio sostituto, valuterò l'acquisto con 5 stelle. Avevo anche acquistato diversi accessori che non voglio sprecare.Modificato il 20/6/20. Ho ricevuto il mio sostituto da Amazon, come al solito un servizio clienti straordinario. Sembra che abbia avuto la sfortuna di prendere un limone. La sostituzione è eccellente, funziona perfettamente e adoro usarla. Mi dispiace di non aver conservato i 2 libretti forniti con il primo che erano molto migliori di quelli forniti con la sostituzione. Interessante che ho dimenticato di includere i 2 cucchiai bianchi e la sostituzione non includeva i 2 cucchiai. Quello che mi stupisce è che è stato spedito prima che ricevessero la sostituzione non appena UPS ha effettuato l'accesso. Ad ogni modo sono molto contento di questo IP e del fantastico servizio di Amazon.

Name: Emhodew
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​28 luglio 2020
Review Content: I have used this to cook rice, pasta, make soup and many other dishes. But I use it every day to cook my veggies.Put some water in the pot, veggies in the strainer basket, steam for 5 min, delicious veggies.When I was a child my parents had a pressure cooker. It was hard to use and dangerous. I was not allowed in the kitchen when they used it.The instant pot is very easy to use. It seams well constructed and the safety features mean you can not open it until the pressure has been released.I really use it almost every day.

Name: Diana S. Daniels
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2017
Review Content: Just bought a 3 qt instant pot and I can’t live without it. Fast, efficient and healthy! I had read an article by a personal trainer not employed by Instant Pot. She was so impressed she invites her clients to a demo and dinner. There is a learning curve so I needed to read the directions carefully and proceed carefully. Once I did that I was hooked. There’s lots of recipes and direction on line and Facebook support groups. I’m a one-person household so I bought a mini. That is my only regret. I like to have enough for a few meals not just one and a 6 qt would have been better. I had bought a pressure cooker a couple of years ago and never used it. I found the directions daunting. Instant Pot makes it simple and replaces other appliances like a Ricer, steamer and slow cooker. I put Instant Pot along side the invention of the safety pin.

Name: MerrY RevieWer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2019
Review Content: Verified Purchase

Name: Danielle D
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2019
Review Content: I finally jumped on this Instant Pot craze after reading an article about being able to make wine in it. I received a model for Christmas and took it back because it didn't have the function needed to make wine and purchased this model.Well, the wine cooked like it was supposed to. It is still fermenting in the bottle so the real test will come in a few weeks when it is ready for sampling.As for cooking food, I cannot believe I waited so long to buy an Instant Pot. Where has this been all my life? I don't know if I will ever go back to using my stove. It is so easy to use and seriously cooks food in a fraction of the time. I made a roast with potatoes and carrots in 40 minutes! That would have taken all day in a slow cooker or several hours in the oven! And frozen chicken-12 minutes. 12 MINUTES!Now I will say, it is a bit bulky and takes up some counter space, but really the awesomeness of this thing outweighs that. The pressure release also scares my dog a bit, but she scares easily anyway so I make sure to give her calming treats before I use it. I really don't have anything else bad to say about this. If you are looking for a simple and easy way to make dinner, this is what you need.

Name: Kate
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019
Review Content: I have to issues for using this:1. It shows message “food burn” too often, even with enough liquid.2. “Porridge” evaporates all milk from the holes!!! Everywhere is a mess!!! To wash all this mess and pot takes more time than cooking and eating.Everything else works good. It safe my time while I spend time with my little baby (well, when I don’t cook with “porridge”).

Name: Richard E Garde
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2019
Review Content: This little appliance is just next level! I heard about Instant Pot, got curious and got the small (3 qt) one to try. The 3 qt makes meals for one to two persons. I saw some videos on use and recipes. Most tout taste and time and they are right! I have made one delicious dish after another easily and in less time than other food cooking methods. I'm now using the Instant Pot for almost all my one pot meals. FYI, I made an unbelievable pasta sauce bursting with flavor - but I don't like putting spaghetti noodles in with it. Call me old fashioned but I like to boil the noodles - I get a cleaner taste because I get to strain the noodles.  One thing I'm not crazy about is the clean-up. The silicone seal in the lid keeps the odor of the last meal cooked despite mega scrubbing attempts. Saw one vid where the lady bought extra silicone seals and swapped them out when cooking similar meals. Good idea. Still my new favorite way to make meals.

Name: Randall Frech
Review Title: Warrantee service is not what you would expect.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2019
Review Content: I really loved this product. Easy to use, lots of recipes around that I could try, easy to understand how it works. Real time saver. My favorites where making pulled pork, doing beans really quickly and then I branched out and started to experiment on my own with some Thai dishes.  So why the 2 star review. Well that is simple. One Sunday I decided to make beans and rice. Things were going pretty well but all of a sudden I smelled this acrid electrical smell and my Instant Pot died. I was disappointed since it was only 4 months old but given that the company offers a year warrantee I figured I’d contact them and they’d send me a new one and I’d be off to the races again. Au contraire.After providing a lot of documentation that included pictures and serial numbers (logical I guess) I was told I would get a replacement. What I wasn’t told was they were only sending the base. Not the entire unit. I guess they think they can save some bucks by only replacing the base and having you keep the lid and the insert. Ok. I can see that too.HOWEVER, they ran out of bases. I’ve been emailing the customer service department and they respond pretty quickly with “the part you need is not available.” Then they go on to tell me they don’t know when it will be available.So the deal is you can get a warrantee replacement. The fine print is that it’s only the part that is broken and they don’t have those in stock, and they don’t know when they are going to get them in stock again.I find it hard to believe that the Instant Pot people know so little about their business that they don’t know when the next shipment of bases will be arriving. I am pretty sure somewhere over in corporate planning someone has a spreadsheet that says we’re going to get 5,000 bases on August 18th so we’ll be able to tell these customers that.Or maybe not. Maybe their corporate planning department is on vacation in August and there’s no one in that department. Maybe they really have no idea what is going to show up next. I can imagine people at the warehouse standing on the loading dock waiting on the truck to back up to see if there is anything in it.In ogni caso un ottimo elettrodomestico che manca di servizio in garanzia o servizio clienti. Ci sono altre opzioni sul mercato che, se potessi ottenere un rimborso, probabilmente proverei. Non impressionato.

Name: Ciprian
Review Title: Pulizia e cottura facili e veloci
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​9 maggio 2020
Review Content: Fa da 5 a 6 pasti (ho comprato la dimensione media), quindi è ottimo per preparare i pasti. Ha bisogno di un coperchio a tenuta Tupperware in modo da poterlo conservare in frigorifero per la settimana se non stai preparando i pasti in contenitori separati. Super conveniente così com'è e molto veloce e senza pensare o pianificare. Basta tagliare e gettare la pentola. Cuoce molto velocemente e mantiene il cibo caldo / pronto da mangiare per 10 ore, quindi dopo la cottura rimane fresco e caldo per il resto della giornata. Fantastico prodotto!

Name: Michael
Review Title: Spruzza il liquido ovunque, non importa cosa, manca il mio Lux
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​31 gennaio 2021
Review Content: Siamo estremamente delusi da questo modello. Abbiamo avuto un Lux 6 quarti per diversi anni ed è stato eccellente. Siamo passati a questo modello per la sua funzione yogurt e abbiamo venduto il nostro Lux quando questo è arrivato. Si scopre che non è possibile eseguire un rilascio manuale della pressione su questo modello senza spruzzare acqua ovunque. Non importa se la pentola è quasi vuota: il rilascio della pressione spruzza il liquido ovunque. Abbiamo contattato il produttore e ci hanno detto che dovevamo solo aspettare che la valvola di pressione si abbassasse da sola o attendere più a lungo prima di rilasciare la pressione manualmente, ma non abbiamo mai avuto questo problema con il nostro Lux. Ovviamente il Lux ora non è più disponibile ed è esaurito da tempo. Credo che ci sia un grave difetto di progettazione con questo modello perché "basta aspettare"

Name: Lorraine e Terry
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​10 maggio 2017
Review Content: Quando ho comprato questa pentola istantanea durante il gelido inverno del Montana, ho pensato che sarebbe tornata utile per preparare zuppe e stufati confortanti nelle notti di lavoro più impegnative, ma è diventata il mio strumento da cucina preferito anche durante la stagione più calda. Questo è un prodotto di qualità e ne sono molto soddisfatto. Alcuni revisori consigliano di acquistare un sigillo per coperchio in silicone aggiuntivo da utilizzare per cucinare dessert, poiché il sigillo assorbe la fragranza di piatti salati, a base di erbe e conditi con aglio, ma rimuovo il sigillo dopo l'uso e lo spruzzo con aceto bianco e aspetto qualche minuto prima del risciacquo e pulisce praticamente inodore tra un utilizzo e l'altro.

Name: Manna
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​29 novembre 2017
Review Content: I nabbed one of these bad boys on sale and it arrived quickly, efficiently packaged, and in working order. I made three dishes in it, details below. TLDR at bottom.The same day that it arrived, I went grocery shopping and saw a 13# turkey on sale for $0.50/lb. I had to grab one and decided to test my new Instant Pot. I have never cooked my own turkey before but figured for $7, I was willing to try. Since the turkey was too big for the 8qt Instant Pot (according to the manual you want food to fit below a certain line), I cut off the poor bird's legs and stuffed it in the pot along with some water mixed with spices and powdered stock. The Instant Pot took maybe 40 minutes to pressurize and then cooked for my manual request of 60 minutes on high pressure. I checked the internal temp on the bird before removing and it was good to go. Folks, the meat was already falling off the bones, it was so tender. I decided to take the whole pot and dump it into a strainer resting over a larger bowl (to catch all the juices) and transferred the turkey to a pan to rest.Next, I took some fingerling potatoes cut in halves along with about a cup of the saved juices and roughly followed the small roast potatoes recipe from the recipe book that was included. This also used to pressure cooker function, which I noticed took less time to pressurize this time (probably because it wasn't so stuffed). These potatoes came out perfectly cooked (and delicious) in about 30 minutes from start to finish, including prep.Last, I decide to use the Saute function to make some gravy. The pot heats pretty quickly for this function, even if you haven't already been cooking. I used the remaining juices from the turkey, added flour,and whisked on high until incorporated, then turned back down to low to simmer. Bam - delicious gravy.TLDR: I made a delicious Thanksgiving dinner in under 3 hours from start to finish on my first ever attempt AND with an unfamiliar appliance. I'm sold and can't wait to use it again.

Name: Southern Charm
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2019
Review Content: My mama found herself needing this after a funeral when somehow she wound up hosting several guests from the funeral for lunch. She had no meat defrosted and had little time to spare. She had not used the instant pot before and she is not a spring chicken nor tech savvy at all. Further, either the directions did not come in the box or she had taken them out when she inspected it (it was my Christmas gift to her) a few months ago and they got thrown away. At any rate, she did not have any directions whatsoever. But between my dad and she, they were able to cook a frozen (whole) turkey in minutes (and were able to figure out how to use it easily without killing themselves). This is a miracle machine! They were amazed how brilliantly the turkey turned out--cooked perfectly!

Name: Leyla Lee
Review Title: Updated review because I  received a replacement for the duo mini whoo hoo!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2018
Review Content: New reviewI received another like new with no missing parts...the box was the only thing damaged.  This is my 2nd my other pot is a 6qt Lux so now I have 2.  The ip duo mini is perfect for eggs, pasta etc.....I do roasts, soups like ham n beans, pea soup and chili in the 6qt...using fresh dried lentils and beans!  I love it!  It’s just me but I cook Sunday dinner after church for my 22 yr old Son.  I also share with my neighbors.  Cheese cake is in my future when I get the right pan.I tell everyone about the instapot...I’m late to the party but a huge fan.  My hands are crippled from rheumatoid and using and oven is not possible.  Thanks to instapot I can still cook, and really healthy stuff. Hit me up if you have any questions.Previous returnedThe condensation collector is too big. I believe it is for a bigger or not the duo mini. Can’t see using it with condensation running into the base. Also received with no instruction booklet or any paper work for that matter, Returning. Ordering another in its place because I want it. Lol

Name: Trangy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020
Review Content: Made dinner for the entire family last night and this Instant Pot made it so easy!!! Bought this to replace our old stove top pressure cooker and after using it, can’t believe I waited so long to buy one! Very easy to use, just press the Pressure Cook button to start and set the timer.  Took about 10 minutes to reach pressure and our entire Chicken Alfredo meal was cooked in 3 minutes after.  I swear it took longer to cut up and prepare all the ingredients.  I was concerned about turning the venting knob being unsafe, but it was easy to turn the know using the back of a ladle so you’re not too near the escaping steam.  The pot comes with a trivet tray only, definately consider buying additional accessories for the Instant Pot as it allows you to make so many other things. Can’t wait to try making cheesecake with this tonight!

Name: Shelly O
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2020
Review Content: I received my IP 4 days ago and used it for the first time today. Mind you I didnt cook anything big, I just boiled some pasta and made some chicken alfredo. I washed the inner pot and it looked like I cooking regularly on it it for 6 months. At this point I dont even know if it's safe to cook from. I'm not sure what material it's made of but it looks partially rusted. Before anyone come for me I used a silicone spoon and I DID NOT use harsh sponge. Very disappointed. At this point I just want to send the whole damn pot back because this should not be.

Name: Ash
Review Title: Very useful addition to my kitchen
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2020
Review Content: I bought an instant pot duo and is the best addition to my kitchen in recent years.  I would advice anyone thinking about getting one to go ahead and take the plunge as it will simplify your life a lot.  I have started cooking 3 weeknight dinners on a sunday night.  It does not take too long and I have this peace of mind knowing I planned ahead and have good healthy food ready for my family for the first 3 weekdays. This way dinner is ready and no one has an excuse to go for the snacks when they come home.  If I am home early on thursdays and I have planned well and bought all the ingredients, I am able to get the instant pot going again for another bulk meal prep and this takes us through the workweek.Nei fine settimana siamo flessibili e mangiamo fuori, portiamo fuori, pizza ecc. Oggigiorno sono felice che tutta la nostra famiglia mangi sano 5 giorni su 7 quasi tutte le settimane. E non mi sento in colpa quando ci concediamo alcuni dei nostri cibi preferiti (non così salutari) nei fine settimana. Ci sono così tante ricette per realizzare tutti i tipi di ricette utilizzando il piatto istantaneo online e su YouTube e Facebook che chiunque può imparare facilmente e mangiare sano.

Name: Margie
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​28 maggio 2019
Review Content: Ero così entusiasta di avere questo vaso istantaneo. Il problema è che a volte funzionerebbe e altre volte il vapore uscirà dai lati del coperchio. Per questo motivo, il messaggio di errore veniva visualizzato e il cibo veniva bruciato. Per non dire altro, sono molto deluso.

Name: Peggy L Duncan
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​10 dicembre 2017
Review Content: Amo così tanto il mio IP. Avevo un Duo da 5 quarti ma ne volevo un altro dato che molti ne possiedono diversi, anche 4! Quindi il cyber Monday ho visto questo Duo Plus da 8 quarti per un affare così dolce che l'ho preso e sono così felice di averlo fatto! La mia prima ricetta in questo era una doppia ricetta di salsa di mirtilli fresca fatta in casa! Così veloce, facile e gustoso! Non puoi sbagliare con queste meravigliose pentole a pressione! Non aver paura. Non è quello vecchio stile di tua nonna. Questi hanno così tante casseforti fallite. Un consiglio è che se sei nuovo e nervoso e hai Facebook, unisciti al gruppo lì chiamato Instant Pot Community! Così tanti membri che sono così utili. Mi sono iscritto per circa 4 giorni, ho letto ogni post, raccolto ottime informazioni e poi mi sono sentito pronto per usare il mio IP e da allora sono andato forte. IO' Ho visto una recensione negativa qui e mi chiedo perché sia ​​così critica e non credo che l'azienda le abbia ignorate. Fanno sempre le cose per bene e le persone su FB che hanno avuto problemi hanno presentato un ticket e le cose sono state sistemate, quindi mi chiedo se la persona dell'uva acida lavora per un'altra azienda, hmmm, lol, non lo saprò mai! Per quanto riguarda me e milioni di altri, adoriamo i nostri IP! Orgoglioso di essere un idiota 😂Adoro preparare i teneri arrosti nel mio! Fagioli, riso, casseruole, lo chiami! Il prossimo sarà quello degli yogurt! Divertiti a cucinare. Come per qualsiasi cosa, c'è una curva di apprendimento. Studia velocemente in modo da evitare errori. Non ho mai avuto un fallimento nel mio. Niente è bruciato o scoppiettato perché prima ho imparato a evitarlo! Vai avanti. Acquistane uno ... o due ... o più 🍚🤗

Name: Miserabile eccesso
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​15 ottobre 2019
Review Content: Ho trovato questo fornello per niente facile da usare. In realtà, fa un po 'paura. Non c'è niente sullo schermo LCD per dire che si sta riscaldando e richiede dieci minuti. E gli altri "prompt" vengono visualizzati in qualcosa di simile al codice di avvio segreto. Devi essere la CIA per capire in quale modalità si trova la macchina E PER CAPIRE QUANDO HA FATTO CUCINARE, il che credo renda i progettisti negligenti. E avrai bisogno degli occhi di un falco per determinare in quale posizione si trova il "galleggiante di sicurezza". Inoltre, la valvola di rilascio del vapore è uno scherzo allentato ed è difficile fidarsi. Una pentola a pressione è potenzialmente pericolosa e deve essere facile da capire per usarla in sicurezza. Grande errore nell'acquisto di questo. Mi sembra di aver invitato un mostro meccanico, un mostro pericoloso, nella mia cucina.

Name: Rolen K. West
Review Title: solo non è la mia cosa
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​1 febbraio 2019
Review Content: I gave into the Instant Pot craze and gave it a try. It didn't work for me. Most of the amazing recipe times don't include the time it takes for the unit to pressurize and depressurize. I hated that you can't check on or taste the food while it's cooking, which should have been a no-brainer but just wasn't something I realized was important to me until after I tried using this. Also, anything starchy (like potatoes or split-pea soup) makes it really hard to clean. I've had a multi-function rice cooker that I can also use as a slow cooker, oatmeal cooker, steamer, and even to saute, and with that I don't need an Instant Pot. My super rice cooker is fast enough for me and I can monitor my food throughout. If you're on the fence, maybe a non-pressurized multi-cooker would be enough for you too.

Name: Saylee
Review Title: Stopped working. Received replacement from instant brands customer service.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2020
Review Content: If I were to rate the Instant Pot on the way it performed the first couple of times I used it, I would give it a 5. It made my life convenient. I could add things to it to steam for my baby and return in an hour to a meal for my kid.The instant pot however stopped working about 2 months in (I owned it for 6+ months, but started actively using only 2 months ago). It still works, but things are ALWAYS half cooked (in spite of adding extra water and extra cooking time). Just imagine, the risks! What if I had absent mindedly served half cooked meat to my baby.I contacted their customer service and they made a run through hoops - sending photos, explaining things again and again. The resolution: They sent me an email eventually stating that they will offer me a "DISCOUNTED" price of $63. I thought it was a joke since the product is available everywhere for $59.99. It almost seemed like spam to me. I have never experienced such terrible customer service.I should add that in spite of having sold a sub-par product to me, Amazon customer service was no help either.After 10+ days of dealing with the Instant Pot Custumer service team, I am stuck with a broken instant pot and complete distrust for Instant Pot as a brand. To conclude, when the instant pot works it works well, but when it stops working you will have to toss it.Buy this if you want to gamble with $59.99.UPDATE: Since writing this review, instant brands did send me a replacement instant pot mini. It arrived today.

Name: P. Davis
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2017
Review Content: I am a farily experienced IP user and got the mini for side dishes and daily cooking for a household of 2.  It is perfect for us, and takes up less counter space than my 6 quart.  Perfect to make 1/2 gallon of yogurt, which I do weekly.  Using the IP does require a bit of learning but so worth it in the end.

Name: MJJ
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2018
Review Content: I love this little pot.  It is plenty big enough for two people.  It is so easy to use and the clean up is minimal.  So far I have not made anything that didn’t turn out very welll.  I boil eggs, and the shell almost falls off, even fresh eggs.  Chicken breasts are so flavorful and juicy, and hot Chile in minutes is fantastic.  Soup in winter is the best, prep the Vegetables and then sauté in the. Pot for great flavor, add the liquid, put on the cover, and the best part, walk away and let it work it’s magic.  So much time saved.  I just ordered one for my son and daughter in law, they raved over the chicken I made in it.

Name: Melissa Rappleye
Review Title: I fought the fad to buy one, but I broke down and LOVE it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2019
Review Content: When people explained what it did, it didn't seem that great. Honestly, it didn't seem to save a lot of time because people were always talking about how fast pasta is now..... isn't pasta already really fast the make?I finally bought one because I really wanted to make yogurt and and try it out and Amazon had it on a good sale, so I bought it and I LOVE IT.PRO:Perfect shell melt off hard boiled eggs and fast, perfect every time so far.Makes better rice than my rice cooker (I cook it in a bowl in the pot with 1 to 1 ratio) perfect every timeI was able to make shredded pork in 45 mins, rather than 8 hours and didn't change the flavor at allThe yogurt took a while to get down, but it is good, different, but good. Kids liked itBaked potato in 15 mins!I love that I don't have to turn my oven hot and make my house boiling. It is perfect for summer cooking when you need to keep the house coolI can saute in the pan and cook in the pan, less dirty dishes.ConIf you burn something bad in the pan it is hard to get clean, but it is do able.You need to get comfortable with this machine and it is a little intimidating, but it is worth itThere is a learning curve with some items, like dairy items, learning how long to cook things, how much liquid needs to be in the pan, NOT accidentally leaving valves open ha ha.But, worth the money and storage. I use it multiple times a week.

Name: Emiliya Pekker
Review Title: Good device, but has some disadvantages
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2021
Review Content: I bought one for myself a little bit more than a year ago but started using it just lately. Then I bought another one for my daughter. I am still not familiar with all the features, so my usage is very limited.  I figured out how to make soups and meat.Pros: The greatest feature is that Instant Pot really save your time in food preparation.It saves energy as well.You can leave pressure cooker unattended.Sometimes the taste is much better due to flavor conservation.Cons: It is time consuming to learn how device works.  And it is not easy to learn.It is not quite safe, especially on a pressure mode.  Thus, when I started cooking, I didn’t put a vent into sealing position, and there were no alarms notifying me that it is wrong.  I left the kitchen, and when came back the whole kitchen was full of steam.It is not a picnic to clean the pot. You have to disassemble everything to clean and then put it back.The odor of the cooked food remains even after thorough cleaning.It takes a long time to come to pressure.You cannot adjust salt or any seasonings during cooking or look inside.It’s expensive.Overall, a pressure cooking is a great way to cook your dishes.  Considering so many cons, Instant Pot deserves 3 stars, but because I really like some dishes made in this pressure cooker, I am giving 4 stars.

Name: S. Smith
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2020
Review Content: This one was the right size for us and it can do so much.  It's easy to learn how to use it and you can do whole meals in one pot from start to finish.  The pot itself is easy to clean, however, you will need to invest in purchasing the silicone seals because over time they will permanently pick up smells from your seasonings that will not come out.  We bought a 5 pack pack of seals and use the right seal with the right dish so to speak.  Overall, great kitchen device that you will actually use over and over again.

Name: Daniel J. Mcmillan
Review Title: Not a replacement for stovetop pressure cooker or even crock pot.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019
Review Content: Volevo questo per fare lo yogurt fatto in casa, che fa bene. Ma per altri tipi di cottura ci sono alcune limitazioni. La funzione di cottura lenta non è abbastanza calda per cuocere effettivamente il cibo. La guida per i fagioli secchi prevedeva 25 minuti di cottura a pressione e non era abbastanza, poiché erano ancora duri quando il ciclo era finito. Questa mattina ho fatto un po 'di farina d'avena per 3 minuti ad alta pressione, sulla base della guida inclusa, e mi è apparso un messaggio di errore "brucia". Se l'unità è in grado di riconoscere una bruciatura, dovrebbe abbassare adeguatamente il calore! Ho una bella e robusta pentola a pressione con piano cottura e due pentole di coccio e ho pensato che questo potesse sostituirle entrambe, ma no.

Name: 10BirdGirl
Review Title: Lo adoro ma le dimensioni ci vogliono per abituarsi
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​2 gennaio 2020
Review Content: Adoro le dimensioni, motivo per cui l'ho comprato. Tuttavia, in passato, non avrei mai cucinato con questa piccola pentola. Ora che sono single e vivo senza un gruppo di persone, sono diventato piccolo. Wow. è che ci vuole anche un po 'di tempo. Tendo ancora a essere scioccato da quanto poco contiene questo piatto, ma mi ci abituerò, col tempo. Lo sto ancora amando. Funziona benissimo. Alla mia età, e vista l'occhio, quando vedo il pulsante per lo sfiato o il sigillo, mi chiedo, da che parte andare - avanti o indietro? Una volta ho sbagliato e la zuppa di piselli spezzata è sgorgata dappertutto. Quindi sto imparando. Successivamente dovrò sbarazzarmi di un congelatore grande e tenere solo quello piccolo. E dopo?

Name: SpeedyReader
Review Title: Ottimo per case piccole e cuochi minimalisti
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​11 novembre 2019
Review Content: Ho usato il 6qt del mio amico per preparare brodo e stufati per le feste e abbiamo sempre avuto molti avanzi. Così tanto da occupare molto spazio nel frigorifero. Volevo continuare a fare zuppe e stufati senza congelare gli avanzi nel mio frigorifero. Sono contento di aver ricevuto il 3qt. È perfetto per 2-3 persone ed è sicuramente un risparmio di spazio. Lo consiglio vivamente a chi vuole cucinare in casa ma con uno spazio vitale limitato. Non te ne pentirai. Il mio 3qt verrà sicuramente utilizzato spesso quest'inverno!

Name: La libreria di Julie
Review Title: Richiede più tempo per pulire che per cuocere il cibo
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​29 dicembre 2020
Review Content: Dopo aver letto il manuale di istruzioni, penso che sia più difficile pulire questa cosa che non ne vale la pena. L'avrei restituito ma il periodo di restituzione è scaduto. Per una piccola famiglia, la versatilità è limitata. Non sto facendo bollire una dozzina di uova o cucinando polli interi. Quanti stufati puoi mangiare in una settimana? Molto deluso, spreco di $ 100. Potrei comprare molto cibo per quello. Inoltre, non avrei mai lasciato la casa con qualcosa che stava cucinando. Ho salvato tutta la confezione per restituirlo, ma ho perso la finestra.

Name: Just My Op
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​31 dicembre 2015
Review Content: Acquisto verificato

Name: CaelenMustang
Review Title: Has changed my life and my eating habits
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2019
Review Content: Pros and cons at the top, full story after.Pros:- Easy to use- Incredible versatile- Meal prep is now a breeze and takes me less than a whole day- SO. MUCH. RICE. I can now actually make a variety rice without burning it or undercooking it. This is amazing.- It sounds like a teeny space ship when you put on or remove the lid and lock/unlock it! I love it.Cons:- WHY DOES IT STILL SMELL LIKE RICE AFTER I CLEANED IT TO KINGDOM COME- Kind of a pain to clean around the rim of the main unit. Will gladly take suggestions on how to do that though, I'm pretty sure it's user error at this point.I thought this thing was just hype and ridiculousness.I was so, so very wrong, y'all.The backstory:I was given a $100 visa gift card and a touching personal note from work for Christmas - a stunning bonus compared to my previous jobs where I either was given a $15 gift card for the grocery store I worked at FOR FOUR YEARS or $35 dollars cash and a hoodie emblazoned with the pizza shop's logo at the pizzeria I had a brief stint at. I sat on this surprise extra money for a while, trying to decide what to use it on - clothes? Nah, I'd recently swapped my wardrobe out, and I was set for a while. I was still starting my miniatures hobby, so I wasn't set on paints yet...But then I saw this beauty of a machine. At the time of purchase, it was on sale so I think it was maybe $60-$70 dollars after taxes and such. I hesitated at first, because this was a considerable machine and my kitchen is not exactly massive.Then I realized it could also replace my ancient crock pot aaaaand that more or less sold it to me.It arrived relatively quickly and I got to assembling it and cleaning the inner metal pot. I was stunned that it wasn't bigger - 6 qts sounds so much larger than it is, but my old crock pot is maybe a 3 qt machine. It comes with a full instruction manual (a blessing), a quick start guide (also a blessing), a recipe book (!!!!!!), and a short note version for the times most things need to cook in the Instant Pot. I do question some of the times inside, but I'll trust the experts.To date, I have now used this thing more times in the past six months than I have used my old crock pot or rice cooker in two or three years. I've made roasts, pulled pork, rice, homemade ramen, chicken stock - while I definitely need to get into a better rhythm with using it more consistently, it has been wonderful to have. Wholeheartedly recommend it, kind of wish I'd gotten the 3 qt size but the 6 qt is more useful for soups and larger batches of food for meal prep.

Name: annette oltmans
Review Title: Burns EVERYTHING except water by itself.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2019
Review Content: We've tried, over and over, because we have friends who have instantpots who whip out amazing meals in no time, and they love it. Ours, I believe, is a lemon. At first I thought it was me (for some reason), even though I'm a veteran in the kitchen (bake my own bread every week, home cooked meals 5 nights/week, bbq, smoke, roasts, etc- i LOVE food and i LOVE cooking). We've tried 6 recipes so far in our instant pot, a couple of those recipes had multiple attempts so have used it about 10 times, and EVERYTIME it displays a "BURN" message before the valve rises. I've tested multiple times with just water and no problem - everything operates as it should. But whether its meat, vegetables, rice, or ANYTHING solids at all, our unit displays the "BURN" message before the valve rises.Unfortunately, we've owned our unit beyond what Amazon will allow for returns/exchanges (but after reading other reviews I will try calling them and explaining our situation).We've called InstantPot twice....only to wait on hold for more than 30 minutes each time before calling it quits and hanging up. Emailed- no response.I really just think the particular unit we received is a lemon because of all of our friends who swear by theirs, so all I want is a replacement since it has only been 4 months since ordering ours, but instantpot is unreachable so I guess I'll be calling Amazon. Hoping the seller sees this comment and can help us expedite this process.

Name: Conservative Robert
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2017
Review Content: I feel compelled to average my rating for the hardware (5 stars) and the instruction booklets that came with it (zero stars) so I am generously giving the package three stars.  There are components (condensate collector) that are mentioned briefly as to what they are, but not at all when they are to be used.  The most egregious shortcoming, and one that will flummox an inexperienced pressure cooker user, is that the cook time chart is totally worthless.  I would respectfully submit to Instant Pot that a DVD showing the different modes of operation and how to properly use the pressure release, keep-warm time, reprogramming of the specific food buttons (rice, beans, etc) and showing use of each of the specific features would be a great improvement, and would greatly flatten the learning curve.  The Instant Pot is a versatile, nearly foolproof cooker and has many truly great features.  But the instruction book should have the pages perforated so they could be used elsewhere.

Name: Customer Nick
Review Title: The second purchase, work less than 1 year
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2019
Review Content: This is a nice cooker when it works. This is my second  purchase of the same cooker. Both of them stopped working in less than 1 year. I have 4 years standard warranty from SquareTrade. I started my communication from Amazon, they told me that I need to contact the SquareTrade. I am seating on the phone with SquareTrade  more than one hour and nothing good happened. They say that Amazon must resolve the issue. However, Amazon passing me to SquareTrade. This is a nightmare. I never will buy a cooker from this manufacturer. The SquaeTrade standard protection plan is a bad joke

Name: Kindle Customer   jp in denver
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2019
Review Content: La seconda volta che ho usato l'unità è arrivata la pressione, ha avviato il conto alla rovescia del timer e dopo 2 minuti è completamente morto. Ho controllato il cablaggio, ho provato una presa elettrica diversa, ma l'unità non si avviava.

Name: Zach
Review Title: Basta aggiungere il cibo e premere il pulsante
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​5 settembre 2019
Review Content: Perfetto per un ragazzo single che odia stressarsi per nutrirsi di pasti sani. Ho appena aggiunto strisce di bistecca con olio d'oliva, timo, sale pepe. Quindi sopra il riso, l'acqua le verdure, il peperoncino chipotle e il pulsante di cottura a pressione. 40 minuti dopo è stato fatto senza quasi nessun pasticcio o preparazione. Inoltre tutti i sapori sono saltati fuori perché la cosa della cottura a pressione ha fatto qualcosa di straordinario per le spezie. Non dovevo nemmeno misurare nulla. Chiamo questo prodotto, "The Food Man Machine"

Name: Helen Mackenzie
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​13 novembre 2019
Review Content: Ho ordinato il 3 Qt, avrei dovuto ordinare il 6-7QT.

Name: La mamma di Spencer
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​16 agosto 2018
Review Content: Lo chiamo il mio vaso magico e lo uso quasi ogni giorno da quando l'ho preso. La mia famiglia pensa che io sia un po 'matto, ma adoro questo gadget. Rende così facile cucinare cose come costolette e pollo! È piccolo, però, quindi se hai una famiglia numerosa vorrai quella più grande, ma questa dimensione è ottima per la nostra famiglia di 3 persone, e quindi utile per preparare verdure, zuppe e stufati, e ieri ho fatto un po 'di cheesecake ! È uscito alla grande! Un tale risparmio di tempo, anche.

Name: Capitano Doug
Review Title: Eccezionale risparmio di tempo per un'alimentazione sana.
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​13 settembre 2019
Review Content: Vengo dalla pentola a pressione in stile XL. La pentola interna antiaderente è solo un interruttore mentre liscivia. Quindi ho deciso di provare InstantPot. Questo modello funziona come pubblicizzato, brodo di ossa in due ore che è stato thourogh, stufato di costolette con rape in un'ora. Fare un po 'di yogurt adesso.   Manca solo una pressione di esercizio sufficientemente alta per l'inscatolamento. Fa abbastanza bene il bagno di vapore. Consiglio vivamente a chi vuole risparmiare tempo e mangiare meglio.   Il mio sta diventando molto utile. Penso che chiunque voglia entrare nella cottura a pressione apprezzerà questo prodotto. Trovo che la dimensione di 8 quarti sia molto utile.

Name: Donna Giordano-Steece
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​23 ottobre 2020
Review Content: I bought the larger one last year and because I cook a lot and like to freeze leftovers. It was too big for my space. I like to cook soups and sauces in the slow cooker. Well the slow cooker broke and was left with nothing but the stove and microwave. No time saving there. So I bought this one. Much smaller but I am so pleased I did. I hate cooking rice. Hate it on the stove. Hate everything about it but I have cooked so much rice in this pot that I won’t have to do it again for months. Freezes great in double ziplock bags. (They are now reusable too.). I can sauté, pressure cook, slow cook. All in one pot. I love it. Have used it everyday, sometimes multiple times, since I got it. Bring on soup season.

Name: Reezie
Review Title: I WOULD BUY THIS AGAIN IN A NEW YORK MINUTE
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2014
Review Content: I've had this about a month and I love it.  I want to say that I bought another brand for 1/2 the price from QVC.  I liked it, but it wasn't real good quality, the pot was non-sick, and we all know non-stick wears out.  Due to other issues, I returned the cheap one to QVC and bought this one.I LOVE THIS INSTANT POT!!  I didn't want to spend the money, but after reading the reviews I decided to buy it and I am so glad I did,  I want to say the quality of the Instant Pot is superb.  I really like the stainless steal pot.  It is good quality, plus it has a heavy plat on the bottom.  I can really tell the difference from the cheap one.  I would buy this again in a NY minute!  I've made pot roast in it in about an hour.  I made tomato sauce w/no meat in 5 min.  The rice comes out perfect.  The other night I decided to put an oven roast in it.  It was 4 1/2 lbs and may still have been a little frozen in the middle.  I put it in for 30 min.  the inside was only 40 deg., so I put it in for another 30 min and it read 150 deg.  I let it rest and put the duo pot on sauté and made my gravy.  When I sliced my roast it was perfectly pink all the way thru and is delicious!!  I haven't tried to yogurt yet, or slow cook or steam, but everything I cook comes out great.  I am getting ready to try my cheesecake in it.I also highly recommend the following book:Hip Pressure Cooking: Fast, Fresh, and Flavorful Hardcover  - September 2, 2014 by Laura D.A. Pazzaglia  (Author)She explains everything, plus gives the time for stovetop and electronic.  She also has done a video on the Instant Pot.  I have a stove top pressure cooker, buy never mastered it.  I have an electric stove and with the stovetop cooker, you have to get 2 burners going.  Once your pot comes to pressure, you have to have a 2nd burner at low heat and transfer it over.  The only problem is you have to babysit it to make sure it stays at pressure.  Just too much trouble for me.  That is why I use the Instant Pot all the time.  NO BABYSITTING!!!!ALSO:  I just wanted to mention that it is normal for steam to escape when you are bringing it up to pressure.  My cheap one didn't mention it in the manual and I thought it was broken and sent it back to QVC, but I am so glad I did because this is much nicer.  I can feel the difference, even the way the lid locks in.  You will not be disappointed if you buy this.  It is well worth every penny (although I wish it was cheaper).

Name: Cyn
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2019

Name: Bunny78
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2020
Review Content: We loved our Instant Pot when we first got it.  The flavors of the dishes we made were amazing.  Unfortunately, the quality of the product is quite low.  The heating element went out within 18 months and the pot was unusable.  We contacted Instant Pot customer service and they made us go through this whole process of taking pictures of all the elements of the pot and then told us there was nothing they could do because the pot was out of warranty.  I told the customer services rep the date of purchase when I was on the phone with her so I don't know why she made me go through the whole process.  They did offer 20% of on a pot from their store, but their store prices are higher than most retailers so it made the offer pretty much worthless.  I am disappointed in the quality of the product and even more disappointed in my customer service experience with the Instant Pot company.

Name: StephanieC
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2019
Review Content: I am pretty late jumping on the Instant Pot bandwagon, but I’m very glad that I did! I ordered this pot before Christmas to help with cooking for the many people that come and go during the holidays. My kitchen is small and I can use all the help I can get. The first few things I cooked in it were large amounts of Jasmine rice and quinoa. Both turned out perfectly! Then I used it to cook potatoes and ‘boiled’ eggs for potato salad and that turned out great also. I’ve made a huge pot of IP Mac and cheese several times that was a big hit and also I’ve used it to make beef stew, boiled chicken for chicken salad and fresh corn on the cob. Everything has turned out well and I keep going back to this handy gadget over and over. My only complaint is the slow cooker portion, I put on a huge pot of black eyed peas and ham for New Years Day and they weren’t done after cooking on high for 10 hours. It was an easy fix though bc I pressure cooked them for 15 minutes when we were ready to eat and they were delicious. This pot hasn’t moved off my counter in the 2 months that I’ve had it and I find myself using it multiple times per week which makes it a terrific purchase for me!

Name: Lorunner
Review Title: I was looking for a vegetable steamer to replace my baby food maker and am glad I purchased this, it does it all and isn't scary
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2016
Review Content: I purchased the 8 quart size and I love it! I was a little intimidated at first, mainly the idea of a pressure cooker and the thought of them blowing up, but this machine is awesome! There are a lot of safety mechanisms in place so you don't need to worry about that. Just follow the directions and keep all vents clear from obstructions. As other reviewers said there is a learning curve at first. I have never used or owned a pressure cooker (just slow cookers) and it didn't take me long at all to get the hang of it. I read the manual that comes with it. My manual had a different looking lid with a part that was supposed to come out but mine didn't. I contacted the customer service number and I got a hold of someone right away who informed me that I had the newest model and the booklet I had hadn't been updated yet. It was very reassuring so if you have questions there are lots of articles online and the costumer service was great. I was looking for a steamer to steam vegetables as my little baby food cooker wasn't big enough for my growing family and my sister in law recommended this. I'm glad she did! It does everything. Steaming vegetables is taking some tweaking. I have tried the timer guidelines in the included book but I noticed my vegetables were coming out too soft. For my frozen broccoli I now just do 1 minute of low pressure cooking with a quick release and they are very soft but not mush. There is some trial and error but even when I mess up things are still edible and taste great. I have done a whole roast (with potatoes, carrots, and gravy) all in the one pot included, pork roast, steamed vegetables, potatoes, hard boiled eggs, etc. I could go on and on! I highly recommend this product.

Name: Vicki
Review Title: Tutto quello che mi aspettavo e molto di più!
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​25 febbraio 2021
Review Content: Questo vaso è tutto ciò che mi aspettavo e altro ancora. Ero preoccupato che l'indicatore Burn si accendesse, poiché molti clienti hanno commentato questo. Ma ho imparato che una volta che non c'era abbastanza liquido nella tua pentola, per le impostazioni o il tempo che hai impostato, appena prima che inizi a bruciare la pentola ti indicherà e afferrerà per continuare la cottura. Questo ci avvantaggia, il cuoco. Dedicati solo un po 'di tempo per imparare il piatto, usandolo regolarmente. Presto sarà il tuo "Go to Pot". Impareremo sicuramente per tentativi ed errori poiché si tratta di un "vaso che si auto-corregge". Dio benedica e goditi il ​​tuo vaso istantaneo.

Name: Mom2micromiracles
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​13 dicembre 2019
Review Content: All'inizio avevo paura di usarlo semplicemente perché è una pentola a pressione e ne avevo visti esplodere. Ma dopo aver letto l'intero manuale e aver eseguito il test passo dopo passo, ADORO questa cosa. Lo uso quasi tutti i giorni. È un dolore nel sedere da pulire, ma rende le cose molto più gustose e richiede molto meno tempo per cucinare pasti fantastici, il che è un vantaggio dato che ho due gemelli!

Name: CMH
Review Title: Cibo veloce, facile e sano in un istante ... beh, quasi!
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​8 gennaio 2020
Review Content: Fuori dagli schemi, sono rimasto impressionato dalla qualità di questa unità. La costruzione è estremamente solida come deve essere per cuocere a pressione in sicurezza. C'è una breve curva di apprendimento, ma i video di YouTube eliminano le congetture dall'equazione (adoro twosleevers.com!). Ero un po 'intimidito dal modello di fascia più alta e sono contento di aver scelto questo particolare modello in quanto si adatta perfettamente alle mie esigenze / preferenze. Sono stato in grado di preparare un fantastico manzo alla Stroganoff e riso fritto. Il pollo esce umido e tenero. Scelgo ricette versate in pentola per pasti veloci, facili e sani con una preparazione e una pulizia minime. Sto solo aspettando le mie padelle Fat Daddio per provare dei dolci genuini! Non posso credere di aver aspettato così tanto per fare il grande passo. Questo è davvero un punto di svolta per quando vuoi cibo davvero sano che abbia un sapore incredibile e ne hai bisogno / lo vuoi rapidamente.

Name: Mustang Sally
Review Title: Questa NON è la pentola a pressione di tua nonna
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​6 aprile 2018
Review Content: Anche se ho il mio IP solo da pochi giorni, sono estremamente soddisfatto delle sue prestazioni. È più grande di quanto sembri, quindi occuperà un po 'di spazio sul bancone. Inoltre, tieni presente che questi nuovi apparecchi hanno cavi più corti. Idealmente, dovresti usarlo lontano dai tuoi armadietti a causa della quantità di vapore che producono.La maggior parte delle funzioni che userete NON saranno nei pulsanti del programma rapido. La maggior parte degli utenti trova più pratico utilizzare la funzione Cottura a pressione (chiamata anche manuale) e impostare l'ora. Le ricette generalmente non includono il tempo necessario affinché l'IP si scaldi o crei pressione, e molti non ti dicono quanto tempo ci vuole per la depressurizzazione completa (quando puoi effettivamente aprire il coperchio). Dipenderà dalla quantità di cibo e liquido, nonché dalle impostazioni di temperatura, tempo e pressione. Ti ci abituerai. Ho cucinato un arrosto di lonza di maiale da 3 libbre dall'inizio alla fine in un'ora e mezza. Ci sono voluti circa 10 minuti per arrivare alla pressione, un'ora per cucinare e 20 minuti per rilasciare la pressione.Parlando di pressione, c'è una manopola sulla parte superiore del coperchio che si gira per sfiatare o sigillare. Ciò ti consente di eseguire ciò che viene chiamato rilascio rapido della pressione. È veloce, un po 'rumoroso e fumante, quindi fai attenzione. Questa è una caratteristica normale e utilizzata di frequente, poiché alcuni alimenti devono uscire rapidamente dal calore. Altre ricette, come i tagli interi di carne, generalmente lasciano il tempo per quello che viene chiamato un rilascio naturale della pressione (in cui la pentola rilascia lentamente la pressione da sola). È come le pentole a pressione della vecchia generazione. Aspetta solo che il perno di pressione si abbassi e apri il coperchio, facendo attenzione a inclinarlo lontano da te. C'è un po 'di una curva di apprendimento per i primi utilizzi di qualsiasi pentola a pressione elettrica, quindi abbi un po' di pazienza. Trovo che il gruppo Facebook "Instant Pot Community" sia estremamente utile.Questa non è la vecchia pentola a pressione di tua nonna. È intelligente, sicuro e versatile. Puoi rosolare le verdure in un po 'd'olio, aggiungere la carne e reimpostare la pentola per cuocere a pressione ... ottenendo un pasto gustoso in meno di un'ora. E, una volta terminata la cottura, manterrà il cibo caldo fino a 10 ore. C'è anche una funzione di ritardo. Puoi acquistare una varietà di accessori per impilare e cuocere diversi oggetti nei loro contenitori, o preparare morsi di uova, uova sode, cheesecake, lasagne e molto altro ancora. Il ricettario fornito con il piatto è minimo: solo un teaser rispetto a ciò che è disponibile online e nei gruppi di Facebook.Il cavo di alimentazione si stacca dalla base, quindi assicurati che sia ben collegato quando inizi a cucinare. La guarnizione in silicone sul coperchio raccoglierà gli odori e molte persone acquistano degli extra da usare con i loro diversi cibi (salati o dolci). Se ti accorgi di utilizzare molto la funzione di pentola a cottura lenta, puoi scegliere di acquistare un coperchio trasparente (che NON viene utilizzato per la cottura a pressione). Spero che il tuo vaso istantaneo ti piaccia tanto quanto me! Non averne paura. Lo trovo molto meno intimidatorio (dal punto di vista della pressione) rispetto alla mia versione in metallo con piano cottura.

Name: doc lio
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​5 gennaio 2020
Review Content: I had made red beans and rice as well as Vietnamese steamed loaf (cha trung).  I haven't quite figure out the cooking time yet so the red beans and rice ended up a little soupier than I normally prepare it.  I hope to make some dal makhani next. I am planning to buy the ceramic pot and already have bought the mini loaf pan for the next time that  I make the steamed loaf. Great buy!Just want to update my review.  I have been in touch with the customer service at Instant Pot to get a replacement for the lid because I had dropped it on the floor and  a piece of plastic broke off the handle.  It didn't affect the functioning of the pot as far as I could tell. They have provided excellent customer service and have responded to my emails promptly.  They had offered a slight discount for the replacement lid.  I was very impressed with Julz at Instant Pot customer service.

Name: james
Review Title: Great tasting stuffed Bell Peppers in 9 to 10 minute time after heat up.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2021
Review Content: The heat-up time is about 9 to10 minutes and a bit less if starting with 1 cup of hot water rather than water from the cold tap. What amazed me was that with the fast cooking time, the taste was much better than a slow cooker but the peppers were a washed-out lighter green rather than the dark green of a Bell Pepper. Seems the faster cooking time keeps in the taste of food rather than washing that out. For some things, this will be better for some dishes and the Crock-Pot, separate slow cooker, will be better for other things. It is a good addition to your kitchen.

Name: Flo
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020
Review Content: I’ve seen other Insta pot versions were they count up after the pressure stops but this particular version doesn’t or at least mine doesn’t.  It just says end. Why does this version not have a timer? Also as soon as I turn it on it immediately goes to heat and I didn’t notice that and I ended up burning something. Why would that come on I don’t see other Insta pots doing that.  If you want an Insta pot do not get this version get the classic instead.

Name: sonia grillo
Review Title: some of them doing a good job but this one by far is the best ...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2017
Review Content: This is the most complete I've ever bought. I've had owned several pressure cookers in the past, some of them doing a good job but this one by far is the best one ever. My complaints with pressure cookers were that at some point the flavor of the food was lost and also I had to use a pan to sauté for seasoning the meat, beans etc. With this one is different, you sauté your condiments, mix with the meats, beans, etc and forget about your meal. In just a few minutes it would be ready, leaving you with a delicious, nutritive meal

Name: DP
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2017
Review Content: Great quality!  Was thinking about sending this back after I ordered it.  Was at Costco and found the "As seen on TV" Power Pressure cooker XL for $50 less.  I was trying to figure out the difference and watched a few YouTube videos.  Here is what I liked: stainless steel pot vs aluminum non-stick coating pot (would never look clean after using), Pressure release assemble much simpler and easier to clean, internal lid is all stainless steel with no aluminum liner lid part. Two heating setting vs one.  I never used the Power Pressure but construction looked cheap and would not hold up near as well.  I really was planning on sending back to Amazon the Instant Pot after seen the lower priced Costco product but the Instant Pot quality was worth it to me.

Name: Kurt Bollman
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2020
Review Content: I’m bummed! I must have gotten a dud, but I’m so frustrated, I give up! I’m returning the Instant Pot Duo Nova. I tried 7 times to boil eggs... I could not get them cooked. I tried the 5-5-5 method on high pressure. Then I added time on 1 egg at a time until I got 1 good egg at 7 minutes. Put 6 eggs in at once using 7-5-5, not one cooked egg! I am so disappointed in this appliance. Guess I’ll stick the old fashioned cooking on the stove, oven, and grill.

Name: Y. Y. Chang
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2019
Review Content: È il mio primo IP e ho sentito tante cose positive sul cucinare. La mia unica lamentela è che occupa così tanto spazio, LOL. È difficile per una piccola cucina avere un forno a microonde, una macchina per il caffè, una friggitrice ad aria, un cuociriso e una cucina. Devo accostare una sedia e posizionare l'IP sulla sedia quando lo uso. Finora ho preparato una zuppa di verdure allo stufato di manzo che di solito mi impiega 4 ore per ottenere la carne tenera. Ci è voluta solo circa 1 ora con una pressione normale. 40 min ad alta pressione per il porridge alla cantonese con riso bianco a grani corti. È facile da pulire e lo adoro ben progettato sulla serratura.

Name: BetsyH
Review Title: Il miglior elettrodomestico che abbia mai posseduto, specialmente nel nostro camper
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​15 maggio 2017
Review Content: Ho usato una pentola a pressione per la maggior parte della mia vita coniugale (oltre 50 anni), ma questa è la migliore che abbia mai avuto. Non preoccuparti che la pressione sia troppo alta o troppo bassa perché non puoi regolare correttamente il calore della stufa. Viviamo in un camper e avere un elettrodomestico che fa più di un lavoro è assolutamente essenziale quando hai una mancanza di spazio di archiviazione. Sono riuscito a sbarazzarmi della mia pentola a cottura lenta e della mia pentola a pressione e di sostituirle entrambe con questa meravigliosa pentola! Lo scorso fine settimana siamo andati a un potluck e ho preparato le uova alla diavola, usando 2 dozzine di uova. L'unica parte della preparazione delle uova è la loro ebollizione e la sbucciatura. Il più delle volte le uova non si sbucciano bene. Questa volta li ho cotti al vapore nella Instant Pot e si sono cotti magnificamente e sbucciati senza problemi. Ogni uovo era perfettamente cotto e sbucciato. Se non l'ho usato per nient'altro, ne è valsa la pena. Lo userò per molte altre cucine, molte altre cose. Ho usato il cuociriso e fa un riso meraviglioso e gustoso che non è pastoso o poco cotto. Ho cucinato pollo e maiale usando sia la pentola a cottura lenta che la pentola a pressione. Non sono rimasto deluso da nessuna delle ricette che ho cucinato. Consiglio vivamente di acquistarne uno.

Name: Dlady
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​6 maggio 2019
Review Content: È fantastico. Lo prendiamo boon-docking ed è perfetto. Prende il posto di varie pentole e padelle. Risparmia sicuramente lo spazio di cui abbiamo bisogno. L'unica cosa che mi ha deluso è stato il fatto che assorbe così tanta potenza che credo 700 Watt, quindi la potenza da terra sarebbe il miglior vantaggio e funzionerebbe alla grande. Abbiamo usato il nostro generatore che abbiamo, una Yamaha 2000 e ha semplicemente tirato giù quel povero ragazzo e letteralmente quasi sovraccaricato di 700 Watt anche con il mio generatore da 2000 watt lo ha abbassato un po 'abbiamo pensato che fosse il 10% all'ora stava disegnando. se non devi cucinarci nulla a lungo. Il tempo è assolutamente fantastico, se devi cucinare qualcosa per più di 4 ore, suggerirei lo shorepower.

Name: michelle mcbride
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​7 novembre 2019
Review Content: Adoro il mio vaso istantaneo !! C'è un po 'una curva di apprendimento MA ho trovato questo canale YouTube da seguire e lui mi ha insegnato tutto quello che devo sapere. È JEFF alla Pressure Luck che cucina da quando lo seguo, mi sento COMPLETAMENTE a mio agio nell'usare il mio Instant Pot !!!

Name: INCONTRATO
Review Date: Recensito negli Stati Uniti il ​​17 aprile 2019
Review Content: I've been using pressure cookers for as long as I can remember.  I'm finally letting my old (20 year) one go, and moving to something electric.  Not really going to miss the hissing jingle of the old one.I have only had this item for a few days, so if anything changes over time, I will update.  As of today, it is a 5-star review.  I purchased another, less known, brand from a BIG store.  It was on sale for $39 and I thought it might be a good deal.  I was mistaken.  Right out of the gate, I had trouble getting that one to seal, and I had trouble with the buttons and total lack of documentation.  I returned it.  Then I ordered this one.  In the first 5 minutes, I knew this was  far better.  Solid build, tight lock.  The pot is stainless steel instead of a nonstick pot like the others.Day 1, I cooked 9 chicken breasts.  Wanted to make chicken salad for me and plain chicken to feed my dog at dinner, so I did not want it browned.  I used the programmed button, but was skeptical because I thought the cycle was too short.  As it turns out, the heat-up process was about 15 mins (which does not count in the cycle time).  My chicken ended up being suitable for shredding.  Not bad, but in the future I will lessen the time to get it a little more firm.Day 2, Pork Ribs.  Ran a high pressure, 20 minute cycle.  Fall-Off-The-Bone done.  I cooked them naked, then brushed them with BBQ sauce, and did a quick (5-min) sear on the grill to brown the sauce.  That's the pic I attached.Next up:  Yogurt.Great user guide and documentation.  I would recommend this product and this brand.

Name: KS
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020
Review Content: I have an earlier version that has worked for my family for several years, so we decided to get a new one for cooking meat etc. and leaving the other one for grains and vegetables. I bought it in September and have only used for a few times (<5). In the middle of a slow cooking program today, it stopped working. We only noticed the screen was off after we came back from housework. It cannot be turned back on again. Luckily the whole thing got shut off so the pressure was gone. Of course this is out of the return window so I'll have to trash it. I would not recommend it to anyone.

Name: David Jacobson
Review Title: Like it a lot, but keep the manual handy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2016
Review Content: I really like this device.  It makes quite a few things just perfectly.  It has very high quality construction.  The cord has the same connectors as a standard computer cord, but is really heavy duty.  It has numerous safety features, like redundant pressure and temperature sensors, and a elegantly simple pressure activated interlock to prevent removing the lid when there there is pressure inside.  But the controls are difficult to use.  That kept it from getting 5 stars.As to the controls, there is this very confusing "adjust" button.  It does different things for each of the about 7 basic selections.  For soups, saute, and slow cook it controls the temperature.  For porridge you use it to tell the pot that it is multi-grain porridge, rather than rice.  For poultry it changes the cooking time.  (Redundant with the +and - buttons.)  For rice it has no effect.  For multigrain, you can choose between 3 choices:40 minutes, 20 minutes and 45 minutes of warm soaking followed by 60 minutes of pressure.  For steam and manual, the instruction manual makes no mention of this button. For yogurt you can choose an option to first bring the milk to a boil.  But for all of this, you only see "less", "normal", or "more" on the panel.  You have to have the manual at hand to know what "less", "normal", and "more" mean in the selected mode.There is a delay function that allows you to delay the start for some amount of time.  (The button is labeled "timer".) When you naively use it, it seems that you can only set the delay to a multiple of an hour.  But, if you read the manual, you will discover that after you have set the hours, you can push "timer" again, and then the + and - buttons will control the minutes.After most of the functions have run to completion, the unit is in a keep-warm state that does what you would expect.  But an extra piece of paper that comes in the box says that you can turn the keep-warm feature off by double-pressing the selection button ("saute", etc.)  when you first start.And, finally, this additional piece of paper tells you that you can silence the beeps by pressing and holding the "-" button for 3 seconds.So you had better keep the manual and the addendum handy in your kitchen.  You are going to need it.

Name: Daniel Flynn
Review Title: Have enjoyed this Instant Pot.  Stews, rice, brisket, whole chicken, curry... loved the results.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2019
Review Content: Instant Pot is all it is advertised to be.  Have enjoyed adding this to the meal preparations.  Stews, rice, brisket, whole chicken, curry... have tried them all and loved the results.  Hard to screw up anything, it's so easy.  Cleanup is supper easy with the removable pot.  One thing to note that I did not realize or really think about, the pressure cooking time call for only a 15 minutes for a particular recipe, but you have to plan on 10 minutes to pressure up and 15 minutes for it to de-pressure naturally.  So that rice time in the Instant Pot is actually 40 to 45 minutes (not 15)

Name: SteveBorcherdt
Review Title: Pressure Cooker Collector...need I say more?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020
Review Content: I have more that a dozen restored WWII vintage pressure cookers. I came kicking and screaming to this purchase. Having vowed never to own one, I was thrown into a living space with no stove/oven, which demanded I seek an alternative. Enter the IP Duo. After seeing more than 100K reviews and a 4.5 rating...I took a chance. After passing the water test and cooking potatoes as a first meal, I have not looked back. Even Google helps with meal prep suggesting various recipes at the first click.  I have enjoyed its ease of use and even its burn warnings which have actually saved a meal from being burned (twice),  YouTube is a wonderland experience for IP owners.  Pick a cuisine and IP has already been there. Yes, I am happy with my purchase. No I don't have a second one...yet,

Name: Lisa
Review Title: A Great Gadget You Will Actually Use!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2017
Review Content: What an awesome idea! One unit takes the place of multiple products! You can use it as a pressure cooker as well as a slow cooker! Saves time and dishes because you can saute then cook in the same pot. It has a rice button, a soup button, you can even make homemade yogurt in it (there's a button for that, too!) There are so many recipes out there in books and online, you should never run out of options! My favorite thing to make in it is mashed potatoes! You can cook the potatoes and use a hand mixer right in the pot when they're done! This wonderful little gadget not only saves on time, but also saves on clean up because you don't need to wash as many dishes, and saves on space because it is so many things rolled into one! Great wedding gift or even for the college student or someone who may be moving a lot as well as someone who doesn't have a lot of storage space.
